role: Working Student (m/f) Frontend Development at SuitePad GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: We shape the hotel room of the future!As the European market leader for in-room-tablets, more than 400 of the most renowned hotels worldwide trust us with their digital guest communication. For our international and agile team of three Full Stack Developers, two Android Developers and a Head of Engineering, we are on the hunt for a frontend focused working student (m/f). You love coding and are on the lookout to expand your knowledge in frontend development? Then we are thrilled to get to know you!About what to expect:Our Engineering Team develops the software and support infrastructure to remotely administer 10,000s of android devices. The devices are used daily by hotel guests and staff, so they have to run reliably. We’re looking for a team member who can support our Engineering Team to the fullest extent of his or her technical abilities, and do his or her best to grow those capabilities. The core assignments we’ll send your way (as a best guest):Special Projects (5-10 hours) - We’d like to let you utilize what you already know and help that knowledge expand. Special projects could include:If you have the skills, write tests to help expand our automated testing coverageHelping write a Github<>Youtrack API integrationIf we’re able to move far enough, we might be able to ask you to work on production code - with close mentorshipOccasional Manual QA (5 hours per week)Assistance diagnosing technical issues with our tablets - sorting out configuration problems vs bugsManual testing of new features for Android with predefined test cases (the hours invested in this will continue to decline as we automate more of our testing, so you can focus on special projects more!)Random technical tasks (<5 hours per week) - depends on your ability, but might include:Setting up specialized raspberry pis, oDroids or other devicesPotentially helping with setups around our new IOT development projectsRandom WIFI setup/troubleshootingHelping SSH into remote tablets to diagnose technical issues from clearly defined instructionsA great deal of your success will depend on your passion and openness to learn and grow.  About your profile:You are currently enrolled in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related fieldYou have growing knowledge in Front-End technologies like CSS3, HTML5 and Javascript. It would be amazing if you had experience with Ember.js and/or any experience writing automated tests in QUnitYou enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and are able to prioritize and work independentlyYou can think outside the box and have a proactive working styleYou have excellent command of English, German skills are a plus but not requiredYou are available to work between 15 and 20 hours per week and are interested in joining our team for at least six monthsYou are eager to grow, can take constructive feedback well, and see yourself in a web focused professional roleAbout our offer:An innovative product with global traction and a lot of, no literally, tons of Android tablets and other devices at your disposalYou become part of our excellent Engineering Team and get exciting insights into our development cycleYou are right in the thick of things instead of watching from the sidelines and you will experience our successful development close upA modern office right in the heart of Berlin and an environment where your ideas and impact are cherishedA competitive salary and the prospect of a long term collaborationYes, we have free drinks, fresh fruits and regular team events but more importantly: we are an international team that is fun to work with :-)Technical Overview:Our tech team has built a robust service oriented architecture that powers over 20,000 devices - tablets, large format digital touch screens, signage and even a touch projector, courtesy of a special partnership with Sony’s Xperia Touch Team. We power our devices with Android, digging deep into Android OS with our own custom ROMs. We’re primarily a Android/Ruby/Ember shop with some services and node.js and moving some services towards Elixir. We’re running our infrastructure on AWS, currently in dockerized EC2 instances with a home rolled orchestration system, but migrating to ECS. Most of our services are back by PostgreSQL DBs, with some redis and NoSQL sprinkled in where it makes sense. Finally, we use AMQP for as a message bus to tie server communications together.Want to join us? role: AWS / Kubernetes Senior DevOps Engineer M/F at FlixBus (Berlin, Germany)
description: To support our team we are currently looking for Senior DevOps Engineers (m/f) to join us in our Berlin office as soon as possible.Your tasksOn Flixbus's DevOps Team, you are going to participate in engineering the next generation of our infrastructure platform. Our stack is highly sophisticated and composed of many cutting edge components. It's implemented based on a self-hosted kubernetes cluster that sits on top of AWS. Continuous operations are facilitated by Gitlab and Jenkins. Centralized logging is powered by Elasticsearch and Graylog. Monitoring and application instrumentation is handled by Prometheus and Grafana.We believe in automating everything and are strongly inspired by Google's Site Reliability approach, so we strive to commit a maximum of 50% of our time to operations and a minimum of 50% to further automation of our infrastructure. The final vision is to have an elastic, self-healing and highly available computation cluster that provides a platform that's capable of handling our massive growth and offers great flexibility for our autonomous product teams.Right now we are in the process of disassembling our PHP and jvm based monoliths, turning them into fine grained microservices and moving them into our new container based application layer. Soon our internal web-based tools, booking engine, mobile and iot backends, APIs and customer facing webservices will all *run* on the cluster.Here another short video about why it is interesting to work for us:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTgYour responsibilities:Full stack development, you will build and adapt Golang, Lua, Python and Ruby based applicationsTeach our delivery teams on how to use the stackContribute to open source projects (e.g. Kubernetes, Openresty and many more)Write configuration scripts to further automate our infrastructureEvaluate technology decisions and implementation strategiesTroubleshooting and disaster recoveryBuild automated tests to make sure all components work properlySkills & RequirementsYour ProfileStrong knowledge of designing cloud architecturesFluent in EnglishExperience working with multiple development teamsSolid Linux, networking and database skillsExcellent communication skillsBe result driven and value orientedOur offerBe part of an incredibly fast growing company with a strong brandJoin a passionate and experienced teamOffice location near AlexanderplatzCompetitive salaryFlexible working hoursConference visitsLots of opportunities for personal growthInternational relocation supportWhat you can expect:Trust and great responsibilityConstant learningHaving a fun timeProfessional training and continuing education12 free bus rides for you and great discounts for your family and friendsSo if you are passioned about the new stack and you want keep up with promising emerging technologies, Flixbus is the place to be. Apply now!

role: Frontend Developer at caseable GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

In addition, we can offer you flexible working hours, an informal working environment with flat hierarchy, and a competitive salary. You will also enjoy our BBQ’s and events together with the caseable team.

role: Scientific programmer in Bioinformatics/Computational Biology (m/f) at MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZIN (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: The Berlin Institute for Medical Systems Biology (BIMSB) is the most recently established institute at the Max-Delbruck Centre for Molecular Medicine (MDC) in Berlin, Germany, which is one of the national research centres of the Helmholtz Association. Research at BIMSB combines state-of-the-art high-throughput technologies with Bioinformatics, molecular biology, biochemistry and engineering to gain a comprehensive and fundamental understanding of different biological systems. The successful applicant will join an international team of interdisciplinary scientists on a vibrant research campus in Berlin, Germany.The recently established Bioinformatics research group of RNA Structure and Transcriptome regulation (Prof. Meyer) seeks an experienced scientific programmer and Linux systems administrator to support the research of the Meyer group. The systems administration work will be coordinated with the Bioinformatics Platform headed by Dr. Akalin.The MDC/BIMSB is looking for oneScientific programmer in Bioinformatics/Computational Biology (m/f)(Reg.-no. 10851/2017)Job description:overall: support the research program of the Meyer group and coordinate corresponding Linux system admin work with the BIMSB Bioinformatics Platform headed by Dr. Akalindevelop, test, install and configure new scientific software and computational analysis pipelines integrating various data sources and programsset up and maintain web-servers for Bioinformatics applicationsconvert new and existing software and analysis pipelines into stable software packages for Linux distributions, e. g. for official release and for use on high-performance multi-user compute clusterprovide written and oral documentation of work including oral presentations of workRequired skills:Essential skills:strong interest in Bioinformatics researchexcellent oral and written communication skills in Englishbility to meet deadlines and to work independently as well as as part of a teamexcellent programming skills in C++, Java, Rexcellent programming skills in a scripting language (Perl and/or Python)basic knowledge of statisticsexperience establishing shared software profiles using reproducible builds (e. g. Guix) and packaging software from source (.rpm, .deb)experience deploying software on different settings, in particular on shared-user high-performance clustersexperience in working with, installing and managing linux machinesexperience in setting up web-servers or proxy (e. g. Apache) and in automated system deployment and linux configuration management (e. g. Puppet)Desired skills:experience in Bioinformatics research, in particular analyzing high-throughput sequencing dataexperience in algorithm designworking knowledge of network storage, hardware, file system management, backup and recoveryexperience working in an international environment and interdisciplinary research settingoral and written communication skills in German (considered a plus, but not essential)Certificates:essential: BSc or MSc in Computer Science or Bioinformatics/Computational Biology or another science discipline with a strong focus on devising and employing computational methodsessential: a minimum of 2 (Msc) or 3 (BSc) years of experience as scientific programmerdesired: Red Hat Certified Engineer or Ref Hat Certified System AdministratorSalary: German TVÖD (Bund/Ost) E13, depending on qualification and experience Start date: as soon as possible Application deadline: October 31, 2017 Limitation: The position is initially offered for 2 years, with the possibility for further extension beyond the initial 2-year contract.For further information please contactIrmtraud Meyer (irmtraud.meyer@mdc-berlin.de) or Altuna Akalin (altuna.akalin@mdc-berlin.de)Please submit your complete application by indicating the registration number 10851/2017 as a single pdf-file by email to Sabrina Deter (sabrina.deter@mdc-berlin.de) includingletter of motivation (1 page max)CV including relevant experienceuniversity and other relevant certificatesfull contact details of 2 or more refereesThe MDC is an equal opportunity employer and supports gender equality.MAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZINMore information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsbMAX-DELBRÜCK-CENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZINMore information: www.mdc-berlin.de/bimsb

role: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at DCMN GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description: DCMN is growing fast and is getting more and more international. Therefore we are looking to hire a world-class Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to support our fantastic team, based in our headquarter in Berlin.We're looking someone (an "experienced DevOps engineer" if you wish) to guide the operational side of our tech team. You'll get your hands dirty and have to maintain, grow, and optimize our development infrastructure, but the focus will be on driving the culture to enable the team to maintain the infrastructure, not on maintaining it yourself. We're currently a ~20 person tech team deploying three products across a mix of bare metal and AWS infrastructure. We are explicitly looking for someone to coordinate the whole team's efforts and provide experience and vision for how to set up and maintain a clean infrastructure. That is, we'd like you to provide ideas and enable everyone to work on infrastructure without pulling their hair out. We're generally very open to doing things the "right way" if you can convince us that that's what it is. The kind of questions we'd like to answer togetherShould we move everything to the cloud or to bare metal?Do we want containers and which scheduler should we use?We need to scale our product globally: Should we set up a "satellite system" in Asia due to latency requirements, or will Europe be good enough for now? What can we keep here, what needs to go into the satellite? How do we synchronize storage? How much would it cost?How can we unify our rather diverse provision/build/test/deployment structure (chef, salt, docker, jenkins, make, ...)?How can we make environments available for development and for staging, production branches? Both for developers across Linux and Mac OS and for the product team?Some things you'll get to play around with:a bare metal RTB set-up handling 100k requests per seconda Spark data science pipeline processing a few hundreds of GB per dayPostgreSQL replication and failoverMySQL on RDSAerospike/Redis/Elasticsearch clustersRequirementsYou should be able to provide well-founded input to questions like the aboveYou are able to understand and modify our current deployment automation toolingExperience in administering and automating networking, Linux, AWS or similarExperience in troubleshooting networking and systems failuresFluent in English (written and spoken)What's in it for you?Work in a dynamic, experienced team of outstanding developersBe a part of an elite international team – we have 30 nationalities!Working with the latest technologiesTake full responsibility from day oneHome-office and remote work friendly, matched with flexible working hours.We're not cheap, you'll get a nice screen or twoFree language courses, pilates classes and massages during and outside work timeWe live work/life balance (!)A recently remodelled and trendy office in a building with other great digital companies in one of the hottest neighbourhoods in Berlin,A competitive compensation and an incentive plan that rocks when you rockInterested?Does this job description sound perfect for you? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. Don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. Your contact person is Theresa Jasaraj (career@dcmn.com).Please note: We prefer applications via our application form.

You will be working with the newest technologies to build a SAAS component which can be fully leveraged within our Zalando platform.Your main challenges will include working with large amounts of data, deliver high-quality recommendation results and at the same time provide a low-latency, rock solid and auto-scaling production system. You will be part of an autonomous and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced software engineers and expert data scientists working on the cutting-edge every day.WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FORYou have 4+ years of experience, working as a (Java or Scala) developer. A technical degree is a plusYou have in-depth experience of working with data-driven recommendation solutions, including creating, implementing, and tuning recommendation enginesYou have worked with current Big Data technology (e.g. Hadoop/MapReduce)You are experienced in building and deploying large-scale, distributed data-driven systems in a cloud environmentYou are keen on collaborating closely with Data Scientists & Data Analysts and have passion to solve algorithmic problemsYou have a keen interest in Data Mining & Processing as well as applied Machine LearningYou’ve worked with NoSQL databases before (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) and ideally also have experience in search engines (Solr, Elasticsearch)You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to enterprise levelYou love to improve & optimize software and to use new technologiesKnowledge of near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plusExperience with Cloud Computing platforms such as AWS is a plusYOUR RESPONSIBILITIESYou will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommender systems in short release cyclesYou will build and operate all services and stream-processed data infrastructure for low-latency personalized recommendationsYou will implement highly-scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your teamYou are ready to tweak and optimize our recommendations for various markets all across Europe for millions of customersYou will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly-scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the jobYou are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutionsYou will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgroundsDesign, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that impact millions of Zalando customersWHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM USCommunity. Tech culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +100 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties and events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks and fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences and meetups, and encouragement to publish work.Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.Scale. Unparalleled levels of data and opportunities.WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!

role: Agile Database Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer (m/f)  (Berlin or Groningen) at Swarm64 AS Zweigstelle Hive (Berlin, Germany)
description: Your Role Your passion for software quality will make Swarm64's products a success. As a member of our application team, your work has substantial influence not only on the stability of our product, but also on the productivity of our developers. Through close collaboration with stakeholders you gather test requirements and implement them in collaboration with software developers. Your work makes Swarm64's continuous delivery a reality and gives the team and company instant feedback when product quality can be improved. You will also play a major role in the shaping of our future testing and quality assurance strategy and direction. Soft Skills Team Player  we test and develop software as a team and make our decisions collectively so we are looking for someone who can both lead the team towards a consensus and compromise when needed as we develop our QA strategy and goals. Communicator  good communication skills are necessary to work with software developers and to achieve a team consensus on future directions and strategies, as our QA engineers are part of the software development team, you will work closely with developers to write and automate tests as needed.Growth Oriented  our company is small, but growing fast and will be growing even faster.  We need co-workers who can help with hiring, mentoring, onboarding and planning for future team and company needs Hard Skills Experience in testing complex software above the unit levelExperience with continuous integrationProficient in at least one scripting language, preferably PythonBasic knowledge of SQL and relational databases Your Daily Work Work in our office in Berlin or in our newly opened office in Groningen (NL).Work with the Product Owner to ensure all features being advertised to customers are covered by tests.Help software developers to write unit tests.Help automate systems to ensure that we can keep quality targetsWrite functional tests with the help of developers.Perform exploratory testing as needed.Work with the team to plan sprints and prioritize bugs and feature backlog.

role: Scrum Master (f/m) Autonomous Mobility Services at Daimler Mobility Services GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description: Our missionThe future of mobility is shared and autonomous. With electric and autonomous vehicles hitting the roads in the next years, we are working towards a new revolution in urban mobility and increase the quality of urban life by reducing traffic and emissions.It’s on us to create remarkable products and services around thousands of autonomous vehicles that bring people to their destinations quick, safe and most convenient.The projectThe Daimler Mobility Services is building up a hub for future mobility in the heart of Berlin.We will focus on customer related questions and make autonomous driving services applicable and prepare its mass suitable use in public transportation. We will build a customer service platform that includes real-time data processing, Big Data analysis and machine learning algorithms as well as a user friendly front end.Your roleYou will lead and act as a Scrum master for 1-2 scrum teams, advise them in agile working methods and help them reach their goalsYou will be facilitating sprint planning, retrospective and sprint demos and ensuring cross-team coordinationActing as a project manager when necessary. Take responsibility for managing dependencies between our team and third parties or between our team and other scrum teams.Reaching out to the larger company network for impediment removal and represent the teams towards other stakeholdersRequirementsYou have successfully completed a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a similar qualificationYou have minimum 3 years of work experience in software development, dealing with sophisticated and technically focused client server products or developing large scale data processing applicationsYou have gained experience playing the Scrum Master role for at least two years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theorySkills and experienceGood knowledge of other agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.Broad knowledge of numerous well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (example: numerous Burndown techniques, numerous Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.)That would be a plusProven experience as a team leadYour work environmentYou will be based at our brand new and unique office in the heart of Berlin. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.The teamAs a self-organised and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.The recruitment processWhen you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and an HR manager.

role: Software Engineer - Backend (Ruby) at Babbel (Lesson Nine GmbH) (Berlin, Germany)
description: Hallo! Bonjour! Hi!We believe that everybody should have the chance to learn a foreign language. Languages are about much more than simple everyday communication, they are a unique window into a rich world of diverse and colourful cultures. Babbel exists to offer everybody the chance to learn languages.Babbel offers 14 learning languages - from English to Indonesian - and, since founding in 2007, we have grown to become the market leader in app-based language learning. There are 500 of us from over 42 different countries working hard to keep this going - we call ourselves ‘Babbelonians’.We want to inspire change and create even more. That’s where you come in.As our Backend focused Software Engineer, you will be self-motivated, full of ideas as well as energy and collaborate with other talented engineers in making our software even better.So, from one kind of language to another, we are looking to talk with enthusiastic and dedicated Software Engineers who speak our language….Ruby/Rails. role: Data Platform Architect - (Java or Scala & Hadoop) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description: The opportunityZalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem. As a Data Platform Architect at Zalando, you will be responsible for building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more efficiently. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.You will work for the Data Services department in Zalando, supporting the teams that are taking care of defining our Big Data strategy. Among the other services that you will help evolve, there are the Data Lake and Nakadi. The Data Lake is a platform that aims to collect all the data and business events generated within Zalando, in near-real-time and batch manner, archive them, offer transformation functionalities and data access that will be used to take data-driven decisions. Nakadi is an Event Bus (open sourced by Zalando) that creates an abstraction layer on top on Apache Kafka (and other distributed streaming platform) providing REST interfaces and several feature like schema validation, schema definition evolution, authentication, authorization.What we are looking forExperience as data architect or senior engineer in larger scale companies in the internet domain like e-commerce, software or infrastructure as a service (SaaS, PaaS), or similarAbility to demonstrate competencies and experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiativesDeep knowledge of big data technologies, like Spark, Flink, Presto, Impala, Hadoop / MapReduce, Google BigQuery and scalable pub/sub event message queues (e.g. Kafka, Kinesis)Solid knowledge of data structures and applied data mining and machine learning techniquesKnowledge of microservice based SOA and service communication using RESTful APIs, GraphQL, gRPC, Avro or other techniques Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Java, Scala or PythonPeerless analytical and critical thinking skills and ability to balance technical trade-offsA great communicator with different stakeholders who is skilled in architecture documentation and technical presentationsEnglish language fluencyYour responsibilitiesDesign and build a cloud-based mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement our existing analytics and data warehouse (DWH) architectureAlign multiple teams to apply new big data solutions and provide support as an architect and a peer review partnerHelp evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projectsShare your knowledge via documentation, coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talksDemonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and othersYou Benefit FromCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized,  autonomous teams and flexible working hours.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact Taryn Bonugli

role: Senior JavaScript Developer - build a digital hospital at medbelle (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Healthcare is one of the least digitised and standardised industries, making it incredibly inefficient and often causing negative patient experiences. We are reinventing healthcare to make it work as it should. MedBelle offers medical procedures whilst leveraging technology to make the process simple from start to finish.Backed by experienced investors, we are helping an ever-growing number of patients and are looking for a senior JavaScript developer to build the foundation of our tech team in Berlin and bring real change to healthcare.You are a great fit if:You're fluent in English (both spoken and written)You have a great understanding of ...JavaScript, Meteor and/or Express.js (or another Node.js framework) and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB as well as API designJavaScript (ES6), React, web basics (HTML, CSS/LESS), fundamental UX concepts and a good feeling for designYou have lead software development teams and have a strong view regarding development processes (communication, code quality, testing, GIT, general DevOps)You know how to prioritise business results and minimise technical debtExperience with microservice architecture design is a plusKey ingredient: You are passionate and motivated about what you do and why you do it, and genuinely want to improve people’s lives.We have worked really hard to build a very driven team that works tenaciously to get modern healthcare to where it should be. role: Abschlussarbeit zu Smart Contract-Plattformen in der Praxis at Senacor Technologies AG (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
description: Deine AufgabenDeine Bachelor- oder Masterarbeit umfasst den Vergleich und die Bewertung unterschiedlicher Smart Contract-Plattformen. description: That's usBecome part of Daimler Group’s unique electronic payment system ‘Mercedes pay’! As leading provider of digital mobility services, Mercedes pay is a fundamental component of Daimler’s mobility and digitalization strategy.Our vision: the customer of tomorrow can pay for fueling/charging, washing, parking, workshop services and many others with our self-designed e-wallet.The projectThe mission of the team is to create a cloud based middleware that connects our core paying platform ‘Mercedes Pay’ with various service applications used by our customers and clients. We want to grow our microservice architecture and continuously expand services, features and paying methods. Our ePayment system is deployed worldwide, used by millions of customers and connects several platforms from various functional domains.Your roleYou will play a key role in ensuring fast and reliable delivery of our core transaction systems and their integration layers. The building offers spacious offices and meeting rooms and excellent connectivity to public transport.The teamAs a self-organized and agile team we work collaboratively to solve complex problems outside of the car. We are an international team of experts which is just about to be built up. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and the eagerness to build services that make daily mobility easier and hazzle-free.The recruitment processWhen you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Stuttgart, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and a hiring manager. Usually there will be a small hands-on code challenge.

description: Senacor Digital Coders BerlinDigital Coders Berlin ist eine neue Software-Entwicklungseinheit der Senacor Technologies AG, die von der Erprobung neuer Technologien, über Prototypenbau bis zur Umsetzung und den Anwendungsbetrieb digitale Softwareprodukte konzipiert und für unsere Kunden liefert. Wir arbeiten in Berlins Mitte in agilen Teams mit neuen Technologien, sehr guter Arbeitsumgebung und passendem Equipment. Dabei sind wir digital, arbeiten mit Passion, sind innovativ und mutig, liefern immer exzellent und schätzen die Zusammenarbeit im Team.Unsere Lösungen sind anspruchsvoll und zeichnen sich durch moderne Technologien / Konzepte wie Simplicity, Reactive Architectures, Vertical Scaling, Polyglot Persistence, Zero-Downtime, Agile/Lean Development, Continuous Delivery, DevOps, Cross-Functional Teams und Design Thinking aus.Senacor wurde 1999 gegründet, erwartet 2017 über 120 Mio. Umsatz, hat über 400 Mitarbeiter sowie jährlich 20% Wachstum und ist für 30 der größten Unternehmen in Deutschland und Österreich – vor allem DAX und Marktführer – tätig. Was wir suchenDu bist (Lead/ Senior) Software-Entwickler, der im Full-Stack mit modernen Java- und Script-Technologien unterwegs ist. Hierbei interessieren dich sowohl Web- und App-Frontends, Business-Logik und Backends, Datenbanken (sql, no-sql, analytics), Integration und DevOps. Gerne kannst du dich auch auf eines der Themen fokussieren.Was wir bietenDu bist Teil einer jungen, stark wachsenden Mannschaft, die sich gerade neu aufbaut und spannende Projekte bearbeitetWir entwickeln Softwareprodukte für große Kunden, aus denen echte digitale Produktivsysteme entstehenVon der Architekturkonzeption über Prototypen bis zur Marktreife mit Weiterentwicklung kannst du in unterschiedliche Zyklen dabei seinAls Digital Coder steht dir das Netzwerk der Senacor Community mit 400 Experten zur Verfügung - von Tech-Gurus bis hin zu Fachexperten und Strategen in ganz DeutschlandWas wir erwartenDie Fähigkeit, sowohl quer zu denken und vieles auszuprobieren als auch komplexe Anwendungen zu bauenSpaß und Passion im Team und das Bestreben, immer erfolgreich zu liefernPioniergeist und Freude am Ausprobieren neuer, aber praktikabler Technologien für den ProjekteinsatzSelbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise in einem dynamischen ProjektumfeldSehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

role: Data Engineer (m/w) at S-Kreditpartner GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: S-Kreditpartner - unser Name ist Programm. Und der macht auf den ersten Blick deutlich: Wir gehören zur Familie der Sparkassen. Als spezialisierter Verbund­partner bündeln wir die Aktivitäten für die Auto- und Konsumenten­finanzierung. Gemeinsam mit unseren Vertriebs­partnern wollen wir die Position der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe in diesen Geschäftsfeldern stärken.Informationstechnologie ist eine wesentliche Voraussetzung unseres Erfolges. Durchgängig digitalisierte Prozesse sind Schlüssel zu individualisierten Angeboten, intelligenter Beratung, neuen Vertriebskanälen, schnellen Entscheidungen sowie höherer Effizienz und Transparenz unseres Geschäfts.Um die Zukunft des Bankings 2.0 gemeinsam zu gestalten, unsere starke Position zu festigen und weiter auszubauen, brauchen wir starke Experten mit dem digitalen Mindset in unserem Team - dafür suchen wir Sie zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt alsData Engineer (m/w)Ihre Aufgaben:Sie projektieren und implementieren datengetriebene Anwendungen (analytische Plattform, Data Lake, Big Data Analytics) im Bereich Auto- und Konsumenten­finanzierungSie konzipieren die Architektur von der analytischen Plattform und ihren verschiedenen Komponenten, wie Data Ingestion und Data Transformation, Data Repositories, Analytical Execution & Processing, Self-Service BI, Reporting & DatenvisualisierungSie übernehmen die Auswahl, das Setup und die Konfiguration von geeigneten Open Source- und kommerziellen Systemen & Tools, implementieren und integrieren die Komponenten der analytischen Plattform, realisieren Schnittstellen zu den Quellsystemen und automatisieren Prozesse zur DatenübernahmeSie haben die Fähigkeit sich in die fachlichen Anforderungen und Kundenziele zu versetzen, können auf dieser Basis tragfähige technische Lösungen entwickeln und können diese Anforderungen der Anwender in die Systeme integrierenSie betreuen und optimieren die datengetriebene Anwendungslandschaft und entwickeln diese weiterIhr Profil:Sie verfügen über einen Hochschulabschluss in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung und greifen auf mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer (m/w) bzw. Softwareentwickler (m/w) zurückSie haben analytische Plattformen in Unternehmen eingeführt und im produktiven Einsatz betreut und bringen fundierte Hands-on-Erfahrungen mit Software­techno­logien wie MapReduce, Hadoop, AWS Redshift, SQL und NoSQL Datenbanken (bspw. MongoDB, Cassandra), Stream Processing (bspw. Spark, Flink, Storm, Kafka), Self-Service BI und Visualisierungstools (bspw. Tableau) mitSie sind sicher im Umgang mit Programmiersprachen (Python, R, Java, C++, Ruby, JavaScript etc.) und beherrschen mindestens eine davon sehr gutSie haben praktische Erfahrungen mit Scrum und Kanban und idealerweise auch Domänenkenntnisse im Bereich Bank/Financial Services oder CRMSie verfügen über ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, eine rasche Auffassungsgabe, kommunikative Fähigkeiten und eine eigenverantwortliche ArbeitsweiseWir bieten Ihnen:Eine interessante, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit einem hohen Maß an Selbstverantwortung und großem Gestaltungsspielraum. Sie erhalten eine attraktive Vergütung, Weiterbildungsangebote und verschiedene Sozialleistungen.Interessiert?Wir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.S-Kreditpartner GmbH Postfach 11 05 4810835 Berlin karriere@s-kreditpartner.de

role: Ruby on Rails Developer - Possible Team Lead at ARGO Trade Solutions (Berlin, Deutschland) (allows remote)
description: Ever dreamed of disrupting an entire industry?Join ARGO and change the way companies participate in international trade!Have you ever wondered how Western companies sell goods to countries such as China or Tanzania for hundred thousands of Euros without fear of never being paid? We help them do it!ARGO is building a new way to take the risk of non-payment out of international trade transactions, helping companies paying when its best for them. We make global transactions as easy as PayPal made it for consumers to buy in the dangerous world wide web.We have just started on our big vision! We are backed by one of the best European VCs, we have a great complimentary management team and are right in the middle of building our first product.But now it's time for us to get help. We are looking for experienced Ruby on Rails champions that share our vision of creating a big disruption and want to build something exciting and fresh from the ground up!As a core member of our backend team, you will help to build...our API-centric Ruby on Rails applicationattached services that help us create the best experience for our customersa broad test coverage to ensure availabilityBoth in Berlin as well as in a remote position, we offer you...a small team of super smart, experienced and driven people that believe in changing things for the betteran informal working atmosphere based on direct communication and feedback with no bureaucracy or unnecessary disturbance: we believe in Slack, limited meetings and fast honest talkdirect influence on anything you build: We know what we want to do, but if you know a better solution, we will go your way!an environment to grow: learn from your team, help others around you getting better every day, visit conferences, get and give feedback regularly and understand more than just the technical side of our businesslots of additional perks such as awesome team events, regular team lunches and dinners, free of choice hardware,...We hope to find in you...experience in Ruby on Rails development proven by contribution to at least one or two projectsa passionate developer that loves to codea team player that can talk code and Englishsufficient Ruby, Ruby on Rails and test-driven development skills  We are super excited to hear from you!

role: Frontend Developer JavaScript (m/f) at CeleraOne GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Develop the future of journalism with us!We are CeleraOne: A team of highly motivated software developers, architects and mathematicians with diverse backgrounds – from machine learning, routing algorithms and signal processing to compiler technology and theoretical mathematics. Please send your application in German or English, including your résumé or CV, certificates, salary expectations and availability

role: Data Analyst (m/f) at komoot (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
description: Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help users all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, and we empower everybody to explore more of the great outdoors. To help us be even better at what we do, we’re looking for a data analyst to help us to drive product decisions and strategy. We believe that data-driven decision making is key to our success and your skills and curiosity will play a crucial role in building the future of outdoor experiences.Your key responsibilitiesTurn events and data into actionable insightsDevelop analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategyDesign and implement metrics, dashboards, and continuous reportsCommunicate and present findings to different audiencesWorking closely with teams throughout the company, solving very diverse data challengesBe an evangelist of data-driven decision-makingWhy you will love itYou’ll be a key player in making product development, marketing and business decisionsYou’ll work with a modern and powerful analytics platform based on AWS Kinesis and RedshiftYou’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workersYou’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you loveWe let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, our headquarters in Potsdam or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3Every day, your work will inspire people to discover more of the great outdoorsYou’ll join us for team gatherings in locations like Mallorca or the Bavarian Alps several times a yearYou will be successful in this position if youHave a burning desire to transform data into actionable insightsHave 3+ years of relevant experience interpreting dataHave proven skills in programming (e.g. in python), SQL and Pandas/RHave strong communication skillsHave fundamental statistical skillsAre keen to keep in touch with the latest advances in your areaHave a hands-on attitude and are highly self-drivenSounds like you?Then send us the following:Your CVA write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in working at komootExamples of your work (e.g. GitHub, PDFs, Slideshare, etc.)Feel free to send us something that shows us a little more about what you’re interested in, be it your Twitter/Instagram account, or your OpenStreetMap profile if you have oneYou’ll get bonus points for: Doing something creative with komoot (we love it when people go the extra mile)

role: Software Developer (fullstack) m/f at MSA Technologies & Enterprise Services GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: In order to further expand our team in Berlin, we are seeking aSoftware Developer (fullstack) m/fA team comprising international specialists works on the safety technologies of tomorrow in our Research & Development department in Berlin – taking an agile and passionate approach and in close collaboration with developers around the globe.Your task in our teamIn your role as Software Developer, you will give our cloud-based software solutions their character and you implement a high-performance architecture that provides access to safety data for our clients – in real time. These are some of your most important responsibilities:Planning: You will prepare requirements and specifications for our platform hosted on AWS while working together with colleagues from Marketing.Developing: You will implement sophisticated cloud-based web applications with the help of tools like JIRA, Confluence or Bamboo.Testing: In close collaboration with our test engineers, you will automate software tests and thereby support our continuous release process.Releasing: Together with colleagues from our DevOps team, you will plan and execute your releases.Optimising: You will also draw on your expertise to continually improve existing tools and processes.Your profile: Expertise meets experienceWe are looking for people who would like to further develop their existing web expertise in challenging projects. Your four facets:Academic: You have successfully completed a degree in computer science or a comparable field.Practitioner: You can look back on at least three years of professional experience in product development.Specialist: Extensive knowledge of web technologies (JS, HTML, CSS, Node.js) is a must, while experience with Angular JS, AWS, agile projects and test-driven development is a plus.Team player: You enjoy working with people across various disciplines – including in an international setting thanks to your fluent English skills.

role: DevOps Engineer / Cloud Specialist (m/w) (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Jenkins) at BILD GmbH & Co. KG (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Deine Aufgaben bei unsAutomatisierung von Prozessen hinsichtlich Continuous Integration und Continuous DeliveryKnow-How-Transfer zwischen Betrieb und EntwicklungUnterstützung der Entwickler bei betriebsnahen ThemenBereitstellung und Betreuung unserer Cloud- und OnPremise InfrastrukturStändige System- und Prozessoptimierung Beratung und Weiterentwicklung hochverfügbarerAnwendungen in neuen und bestehenden ProjektenEvaluation und Beratung im Bereich Technologiewahl und Planung von Änderungen der SystemlandschaftAnalyse und Behebung von Störungen im Server- und ApplikationsbereichDas bringst Du mitBegeisterung für innovative Technologien und Interesse an den neusten technologischen Trends und EntwicklungenTiefgehenden Erfahrungen im Betrieb datenbankbasierter Web-Portale und breites Wissen zu Netzwerk- und SoftwarearchitekturenIn folgenden Bereichen bst Du topfit: Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Chef, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Tomcat, Varnish, AWS, Azure oder GCPProgrammierkenntnisse idealerweise in den Sprachen Java, Shell, JavaScript, RubyLösungsorientiertes ArbeitenSehr gute Kenntnisse von Content Management Systemen sind von VorteilSehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten und DurchsetzungsvermögenStudium im Bereich Informatik oder eine vergleichbare AusbildungDu denkst nicht nur gründlich nach, sondern vor allem auch quer und verlässt gern ausgetretene Pfade um neue Wege zu gehenUnser AngebotWir geben unseren Entwicklern den Freiraum, selbstverantwortlich an der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte mit zu arbeiten und so Produktentscheidungen aktiv beeinflussen zu können.Wir investieren in unsere Mitarbeiter mit Schulungen und Trainings und profitieren dabei von unseren Partnerschaften mit Microsoft, Amazon und Apple. Darüber hinaus entsenden wir Kollegen gerne zu internationalen Konferenzen, um verschiedenste Themen und Fachbereiche intern abdecken zu können. (Google I/O, AWS Summits, Apple WWDC, etc.)Ein reiches Seminarangebot im Bereich der Softskills, spannende Konzernaktivitäten, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Unterstützung für Familien stehen den Mitarbeitern parallel zur Verfügung.Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern eine angemessene Bezahlung, ein jährliches Bonussystem und ein attraktives Aktienbeteiligungsprogramm. Dazu erhalten die Angestellten neben Getränken und Obst, freie Mittagskost in einer der besten Kantinen der Stadt.Die Arbeitsplätze sind hochmodern und werden mit hochwertiger Apple Hardware ausgestattet.Wer Lust auf ein spannendes Projekt, mit der Sicherheit eines Großkonzernes im Rücken, anständiger Bezahlung und guten Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten im Herzen von Berlin hat, ist herzlich eingeladen sich zu bewerben.

role: Software Tester, QA engineer (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Are you keen to push renewable energies further?Are you passionate about quality tested software?Are you a team player and keen getting things to work?Then this job is for youAs a professional software tester and QA engineer at Younicos you will develop and execute test specifications and most appropriate test strategies and improve our test automation on unit, component and system integration level. You look at technology and business facing tests that support the team and critique the product in all functional and non-functional aspects. Within your focus is also improvement of our configuration management, the build and deployment process as well as application lifecycle management.To reach the goals in terms of high product quality and customer satisfaction you work together with the developers as part of an agile team (Scrum) and cooperate with our requirements and system engineering. Together with the teams and the customer you will specify user acceptance and factory acceptance test specifications. You will introduce new tools, if required, to perform and monitor tests that will help you and the team to raise the quality of the products. With your knowledge, approach and open feedback you will continually improve the quality policies within the development teams.With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.Your profileSignificant expertise in software testing in agile teamsProfound knowledge of testing toolsExperience with BDD/TDD, test automation and CI (Jenkins)Some expertise in Python and knowledge of C++, Java and PHPExcellent analytic and conceptual skillsA source of constant ideas for improvementA strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea winKnowledge of SW development tooling infrastructure and system administrationOpen to new technologiesA will to continually improve your skillsExceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracyBasic German is a plusOur offerThe opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy sharesMotivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things doneOpen discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your workParticipation on trainings, meetings, conferences, etc.Bright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of BerlinFlexible working hours

role: Do you want to BOOST.spirit your career? at think-cell (Berlin, Germany)
description: At think-cell expect a wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks.think-cell is looking for smart, creative C++ developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.Skills & RequirementsDo you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you.

A product that tracks hundred thousands of shipments across Europe.WHAT WE EXPECTWe look for an experienced developer who wants to join the team and who is able to focus on getting things done. Are you willing to take responsibility for what you can do best? Here are the skills we require from a person who leads our frontend development:Minimum 3 years of experience with JavaScript, including asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6Minimum 3 years of experience with HTML/CSS/SCSS, including concepts like layout, specificity, animation, cross browser compatibility, and accessibilityVery good experience with browser APIs and optimizing front end performanceGood knowledge of React.js and the concept of Redux or other state management system is a must haveVery good experience with at least one other JS framework (AngularJS, Vue.js, Meteor) is a strong plusGood Experience in testing JavaScript with mocha, Jest, Jasmine or the test framework of your choiceVery good experience working with task runner like Grunt, Gulp and WebpackFamiliar working with GIT on a daily basisKnowledge and using Functional Programming with JavaScript is a strong plusKnowledge of charting library like D3.js or Chart.js is a string plusYou have an interesting open source portfolioEffective oral and written communication skills in EnglishWHAT WE OFFERYou will create a platform to track millions of parcels across EuropeA great product and a highly motivated team that wants to push boundariesRapidly growing team with long-term prospectsA lively startup atmosphereExcellent working conditions with a location in the heart of BerlinWe look forward to getting to know you and to understand your ideas and plans in a personal meeting.We need you on board soon. Therefore, please do only apply if you do already possess a working permit for the European Union. Send your email application to join@sevensenders.com.

role: PHP Developer (m/f) to support the growth of an E-commerce start-up at Contorion GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in our team: We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.We know about the benefits of Clean Code and make use of it!We are not afraid of huge architectural challenges.We believe in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork of development, business-intelligence, design, marketing and operations. What about you?First working experience with PHP >= 5.6, standard frameworks like Zend, Symfony, Knowledge about professional software engineering (paradigms like ‘inversion of control’, clean code, basic algorithms and data-structures, agile processes)Good English skillsOur Technology Stack:You don't have to be an expert in all areas of our technology stack, but most of the technologies should be familiar to you.Backend: PHP 5.6, MySQL, Git, PostgreSQL, Aerospike, ElasticSearch, New Relic, Jenkins, Zend Framework, Symfony 2, Twig, Silex, Composer, RabbitMQSystem administration: nginx, Saltstack, Rackspace Cloud, OpenStackFrontend: xjQuery, xAngularJS, Vanilla JS, HTML5/CSS3, Grunt & Gulp, Kendo UI, Selenium

role: Senior Software Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform GENOPACE at GENOPACE GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Senior Software Engineer (w/m) für die FinTech Plattform GENOPACEVOLL- ODER TEILZEITBerlin, DeutschlandGENOPACE ist die Plattform zur Vermittlung von Baufinanzierungen der genossenschaftlichen Finanzgruppe (Volks- und Raiffeisenbanken). GENOPACE ist ein Teil der Hypoport-Gruppe und deshalb sind wir alles, aber keine Bank. Hierarchien waren gestern, heute setzen wir auf Selbstverantwortung und die Motivation eines jeden einzelnen. Eine unserer Stärken ist, dass wir verschiedene neue Ansätze der Arbeitsorganisation ausprobieren. Wir sind Entdecker der Arbeitswelt von morgen, deshalb legen wir auch viel Wert auf ein professionelles Arbeitsumfeld, denn immerhin verantwortet die Hypoport-Gruppe ein Kredit-Transaktionsvolumen von über 4 Mrd.€ pro Monat.Wer du bist:Du bist ein Senior Mitglied eines professionellen und hochqualifizierten Teams, welches ständig anstrebt die besten und smartesten Lösungen für unsere Businessanforderungen zu finden.Du arbeitest Hand in Hand mit deinen Kollegen aus Produkt, Kundenservice und Vertrieb sowie deinen Kunden und hast Lust darauf eine komplexe Domäne mitzugestalten.Du entwirfst, implementierst, testest und wartest neue Features und Finanzproduktintegrationen auf der GENOPACE Plattform.Du verbesserst dich ständig und hilfst deinen Kollegen und deiner Umgebung besser zu werden.Du übernimmst Verantwortung für die Software deines Teams -  auch in Produktion, denn wir machen DevOps und Continuous Deployment.Du denkst unternehmerisch und richtest deine Entscheidungen an wirtschaftlichen Erfordernissen aus.Was du kannst:Weitgehende Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von serverseitigen Backends mit objekt-orientierten Sprachen (wir nutzen Java mit Spring und Groovy – wir glauben aber, dass du dich auch einarbeiten kannst).Erfahrung im Entwickeln von skalierbaren und verteilten Services.Interesse an Finanzprodukten. Wir arbeiten in einer komplexen Domäne und erwarten, dass jeder beim Lösungsdesign mitdenken kann. Wie eine Baufinanzierung funktioniert bringen wir dir bei.Erfahrung mit zentralen serverseitigen Backend-Technologien wie z.B.: Messaging, HTTP und REST, Webservices, Concurrency, Resilienz und CachingSehr gute DeutschkenntnisseWas wir bieten:Innerhalb der Hypoport-Gruppe wertschätzen wir Vielfalt, daher bieten wir einen Arbeitsplatz frei von Stereotypen. Die Energie unserer Teams wächst mit der Vielfalt an Perspektiven die jeder einzelne mit einbringt. Unsere Kultur fördert ein persönliches Arbeitsumfeld, so wie du es dir vorstellst. Zusammen bauen wir die führenden digitalen Plattformen für Finanzprodukte. Einige der Vorteile, die wir dir bieten:Innovative Arbeitskultur und eine Umgebung in der du Dinge gestalten kannst wie in einem Startup allerdings mit dem Rückhalt eines etablierten Unternehmens.Sehr gute Work-Life Balance mit flexiblen und familienfreundlichen Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office, 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr sowie die Option dir 10 weitere Urlaubstage zu erkaufen.120 IT-Kollegen und Kolleginnen, in der Hypoport-Gruppe, die dich unterstützen und eine aktive Wissenscommunity gestalten.Einfluss auf den TechStack. Hier kannst du von Anfang an mitbestimmen.Unsere Prinzipien nach denen wir arbeiten: Wir führen gemeinsam.Wir lernen und entwickeln uns bewusst weiter.Wir arbeiten gemeinsam miteinander.Wir organisieren uns dezentral und autonom.Wenn du neugierig geworden bist, dann findest du mehr über unsere Kultur auf unserem PnO-Blog. Wenn du mehr über unsere technischen Themen wissen willst, dann besuche doch einfach unseren TechBlog.Möchtest du mehr erfahren? Dann schick uns doch deine Bewerbung, gerne auch mit deinem GitHub-Account.Bei Fragen wende dich anNadine Lennartz, People & Organisation PartnerTel. +49 30 420 86 -1925Hypoport AG | Genopace AGKlosterstrasse 71, 10179 Berlin

role: EMBEDDED ENGINEER (JAVA)  IOT / SMARTHOME at Ewyso GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description: We are looking for a highly motivated Java Developer to help build the best Embedded (Java) environment, so that we can make smart home as common, easy and accessible as a smartphone. For everyone.With this you will help us change the definition of “home” for people of any kind around the world. We believe that a great product will shape the future of our living spaces.Your mission is to build an awesome embedded environment in Java! (greenfield!)Some of your activitiesSculping the future of Ewyso’s embedded devices – from the ground up!!- that power our hardware devicesWorking directly together with the Product Owner (hardware)Creation of software that runs on a constrained deviceBuilding software which runs on the devices in more then 1mio householdsEmpower users to control their Smart Home devices at homeKey QualificationsAt least 3 year experience in Java developmentYou understand the core principles of embedded developmentYou have good understanding of LinuxYou love to share your ideas and know how to communicate themWhat makes us different?We believe that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to takeResponsibility for your role from day oneAn agile environment you will loveFlat hierarchy, awesome cultureA pretty cool office in Berlin ‘Mitte’ + a free gym membershipTeam events such as brunches, workshops, Friday tgif and trainings abroad….Awesome international start-up atmosphere: Work Hard, Party HarderYou think Smart Home is one of the greatest things in the world and you share our passion for that topic?We would love to get to know you!!BUT please don’t write us a book…Generic cover letters are as bad as broken radiator in winter.A compact description of yourself and your achievements will do! :)>>>Join and shape the future of our homes together with us!< <<

role: Full-stack Softwareentwickler (m/w) für den Aufbau unserer InsurTech-Plattform at Smart InsurTech GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Die börsennotierte HYPOPORT-Gruppe besteht aus einer Familie von in- und ausländischen Tochterunternehmen, gruppiert in die vier voneinander profitierenden Geschäftsbereiche Kreditplattform, Privatkunden, Institutionelle Kunden und Versicherungsplattform. Alle vier Bereiche befassen sich mit dem Vertrieb von Finanzdienstleistungen, ermöglicht oder unterstützt durch unsere Technologie (FinTech).Für unser agiles Team, welches eine auf dem Markt einzigartige Softwarelösung zur Bestandsverwaltung von Versicherungen entwickelt, suchen wir einen Entwickler aus Leidenschaft.Welche Aufgaben warten auf dich?Als „Full-stack Developer (m/w)“ gestaltest und entwickelst du unsere Eigenentwicklungen im Bereich der InsurTech-Plattform maßgeblich mitDu gestaltest den Aufbau unserer neuen Versicherungsplattform, die die ganze Branche revolutionieren soll, maßgeblich mit - bringst deine Ideen und dein Know-How jeden Tag.Du bringst uns der Automatisierung und Digitalisierung in der Versicherungsbranche, z.B. bei der digitalen Provisions- und Dokumentenverarbeitung mithilfe deiner Backend-Lösungen einen Schritt näher.Dabei gehört die technische Integration neuer Software in unsere Versicherungsplattform, insbesondere über Webservices zu deinen spannenden Aufgaben.Bei uns arbeitest du cross-functional, agil und eng im Team zusammen und hast die Möglichkeit eigenverantwortlich in einem professionellen Team mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen unser Produkt maßgeblich mit zu gestalten.Test Driven Development und Clean Code sind wichtige Bestandteile unseres Entwicklungsprozesses.Dabei bist du von Anfang bis Ende dabei, d.h. von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Betrieb der Plattform.Welche Technologien nutzen wir?JavaJavaScript /AngularPL/SQLHTML 5 /CSS 3Was erwarten wir von dir?Du bringst dich mit Begeisterung, Engagement und Leidenschaft in unser Team ein.Dein Talent als Java Entwickler hast du während deiner ersten beruflichen Erfahrung erfolgreich unter Beweis gestellt.Mit Webservices kennst du dich gut aus.Extrapunkte bringen dir Erfahrungen in der App-Entwicklung.Wenn zudem agile Softwareentwicklung kein Fremdwort für dich ist, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.Motivierte und fachlich hervorragend ausgebildete Mitarbeiter sind die wichtigste Säule für unseren Erfolg. Nur mit ihnen lässt sich unser hoher Anspruch Tag für Tag in die Tat umsetzen. Wir bieten ein attraktives Arbeitsumfeld, weil wir Talent und Begeisterung unserer Mitarbeiter mit interessanten Aufgaben und gemeinsamen Zielen verbinden. Zudem setzen wir auf Teamgeist, fordern und fördern Leistung, während wir gleichzeitig Wert auf Vereinbarkeit von Arbeit und Privatleben legen. Zahlreiche Mitarbeiter-Benefits wie Vertrauensarbeitszeit, Kids-Office, Sportprogramme, After-Work-Partys und individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten sind für uns selbstverständlich. Jeden Tag!Bei Fragen wende dich an:Justus BreitmeierPeople & Organisation Partner Tel. +49 30/ 42086 1917Hypoport AG | Smart InsurTech GmbHKlosterstraße 71, 10179 Berlinwww.hypoport.de | www.smartinsurtech.deJETZT BEWERBEN

role: Softwareentwickler/in Django/Python at Max-Planck-Institut für Bildungsforschung (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Das Max-Planck-Institut für Bildungsforschung in Berlin sucht für den Forschungsbereich Entwicklungspsychologie (Leitung Prof. Dr. Ulman Lindenberger) ab dem 01.01.2018 eine/nSoftwareentwickler/in Django/Python(EG 13 TVöD, max. 39 Wochenstunden, 3 Jahre)für ein Gemeinschaftsprojekt verschiedener Max-Planck-Institute. Ziel ist die Entwicklung eines neuen Open-Source-Management-Tools für die Organisation und Durchführung von humanwissenschaftlichen Studien in der Grundlagenforschung der Max-Planck-Gesellschaft (MPG).Ihre Aufgaben:Agile Softwareentwicklung von Frontend-/Backend-Services und -SystemenProgrammierung und Entwicklung von Modulen und SchnittstellenKonzeptionelle Mitarbeit an der Entwicklung des SystemsBegleitung des Deployments und der Datenschutz-Zertifizierungs- und Sicherheitsüberprüfung der SoftwareWas bieten Sie:Neugierige/r und ideenreiche/r Django-Entwickler/inHochschulabschluss im Bereich der Informatik, Naturwissenschaften oder vergleichbarer AusbildungNachweisbare Erfahrung in der agilen SoftwareentwicklungSehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und im Django-FrameworkSehr gute Kenntnisse in relationalen und nicht-relationalen DatenbankenGute Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch und EnglischWir bieten Ihnen:Teamorientierte und familienfreundliche Arbeitsumgebung in einem internationalen und interdisziplinären ForschungsumfeldModerner Technologie-StackFlache Hierarchien und Raum für kreative WeiterentwicklungFlexible ArbeitszeitregelungMöglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen WeiterbildungHaben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?Die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, mehr schwerbehinderte Menschen zu beschäftigen. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen sind ausdrücklich erwünscht.Ferner will die Max-Planck-Gesellschaft den Anteil an Frauen in den Bereichen erhöhen, in denen sie unterrepräsentiert sind. Frauen werden deshalb ausdrücklich aufgefordert, sich zu bewerben.Bitte senden Sie Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen vorzugsweise in einer zusammenhängenden PDF-Datei bis zum 04.10.2017 per E-Mail an schaar@mpib-berlin.mpg.de. Informationen zu einer verschlüsselten Übermittlung auf Anfrage.

role: Qt Embedded Software Architect (automotive, medical, embedded, automation) at The Qt Company (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
description: We offer excellent opportunities for a creative and passionate software architect to spread the word about the software development framework that rules them all – Qt.About the RoleQt (pronounced “cute”) is the leading C++ cross-platform application and UI framework in the world. Headquartered in Finland, The Qt Company is responsible for Qt development, productization and licensing under commercial and open-source licenses. The Qt Company has over 260 employees in Product Management, R&D, Sales, Marketing and Consulting Services with several offices worldwide.The Qt Company Service Team helps large global customers to reach their targets by providing them advisory services both in Qt software framework and customer’s software solution. These services include guidance on the use of Qt APIs, functions, methods and programming techniques for all major platforms.As a key member of this team, for the Automotive market segment, you will contribute primarily to the In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI) systems and/or instrument cluster systems. You will represent the Qt Company as technical lead towards a customer on varying project tasks including, but not limited to, requirements, design, and delivery of applications. These applications primarily use Qt, usually on embedded Linux based platforms. You will also collaborate with Qt’s R&D department to apply the latest Qt technologies on your concrete customer use case.You need to be enthusiastic, have a proven track-record of successful application development in the embedded environment. You should be interested in problem solving and quickly adapt to changing technical environments. You will need to work fluently and with pride in the customer interface as a recognized specialist of your own technical subject – A tip of the spear for the technologies we represent. Main Responsibility AreasLeads design, architecture and development efforts for Qt’s Automotive customers (Tier-1s or OEMs)Analyze requirements, functional specifications against the target hardware Create software design for applications developed with Qt and its interaction with other library components on the IVI stackInterface with customers on system architecture through workshops and design meetingsIdentify and address system level metrics, such as: resource consumption, performance, boot time and inter-application communicationPresent technical solutions to customersProvide support to the customer’s development organization; the go to person for any Qt related technical assistanceFocus primarily on securing customer success in using Qt Software products in the Automotive marketRegular travelling to customers Your qualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or higher (not mandatory)Preferably 5+ years of working on large software programsExperienced and talented developer with deep understanding of one or more of the following:Strong C++ experience with successful track record in developing C++ applicationsExperience with major automotive Tier-1s and/or OEMs, with prior IVI or Cluster architecture is a big plusStrong exposure to Embedded Linux adaptation and Qt including Yocto projectExcellent Technical understanding of Qt Software Products (Qt, Qt for Embedded Linux, Qt tools) LocationBerlin or Southern area of Germany / Suburbs of Detroit, USA Interested?For more information, please contact:Bernard Falise, bernard.falise(a)qt.io / European positionsPat McGowan, pat.mcgowan(at)qt.io / USA positions

role: (Senior) Full Stack Developer (m/f) at Quadriga Media Berlin GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: (Senior) Full Stack Developer (m/f)Position descriptionExciting and varied projects with a focus on programing websites and portals in frontend and backend with PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScriptDevelopment of existing applicationsBe part of a cross-functional task force consisting of front-end, back-end, design and product teams.Maintain a high quality standard for our code, features, and products.Your experience & skillsSuccessful work experience as Full-Stack Developer (m/f) in complex projectsProficiency with PHP (ZF2), xHTML/HTML5, CSS3, Sass, LESS and ideally Laravel/SymphonyFluency with JavaScript (jQuery); Angular 2 and ECMA will be a plusVery good knowledge of MySQL and ElasticSearchExperience with Drupal and WordPressUnderstanding of APIs (JSON, XML)In-depth knowledge of Git; Jenkins and CD/CI in general will be a plusKnowledge of project management and the issue-tracking platform JIRA/Con­flu­ence is a plusHands-on-attitude and goal-oriented functioning as well as the ability to work independentlyA clean coding styleExcellent command of English (German is a plus)An open and honest person with a sense of humor and team orientationOur benefitsTraining:  We put a high value on individual training and professional development. You will benefit from five days of further training per year.Colleagues:  Become part of a team of more than 230 highly-motivated colleagues and connect, exchange, and party with them during our regular team events.Careers:  Use your creative freedom, work autonomously, and profit from internal opportunities for your professional development.Work-Life balance: A healthy work-life balance is important to us. We belief in flexible working hours (core working time 10 am – 4 pm) and home office options.Flat hierarchies:  We emphasize transparency, clear decision channels, and a friendly working culture.Community: We create connections and promote team spirit through lunches for interns, trainees, and juniors, 'mystery lunches', social events, 'meet the CEO' gatherings, and much more.Sports programme: Stay fit and have fun! Our weekly sports programme includes yoga, running groups, and fitness.Onboarding: We facilitate an easy entry into the Quadriga world through clear onboarding processes with targeted induction, trainings, feedback conversations, and partner programmes.Location: Work in the heart of Berlin with excellent connections to public transport, a private library, and a green outdoor area.Together we create platforms to connect professionals and managerial personnel. If you would like to be part of our team, apply now with your complete application documents (cover letter, resume, references, proposed salary, and available starting date) via our online form.

role: Frontend Developer (f/m) - Real UI development at Younicos AG (Berlin, Germany)
description: Are you keen to help shape future power supply?Are you passionate about writing clean code?You want to develop something real?Then this job is for youAs a frontend developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical components like batteries, inverters , pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switchgears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the UI development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the design and functional specifications, high performance UI design, test driven development, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the general user guidance, the automation and generation of building blocks of the UI, graphical representation of live and historian data, interface to the database or interface to the messaging system to give you some ideas.All developments are performed in close collaboration with the Y.Q development team and our technical engineers to understand and visualize the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.Your main responsibilities are:Design/maintain graphical user interfaces which allow the operators to control the systems over the webWrite web based reports and extract pertinent information from the SQL/NoSQL databaseDevelop new solutions for time series and event based data for monitoring and reportingYour profileFrom the technical point of view a must iscompleted university studies in UI design, user interaction design, computer science, informatics or comparable studiesyears of professional experience in UI development ,ideally in an agile process environmentExperience in user guidance and UI design.Experience in developing/architecting PHP/MySQL-based web applications (LAMP) ideally for industrial applications.Desire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable codeWelcome isHands-on expertise with JavaScript, DHTML, and CSS, AngularDemonstrated experience with web user interface toolkits.Experience with PHP alternatives and backend programming like Java, Node.js, Scala is a plusExperience with TSDB like InfluxDB or PrometheusRDBMS experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similar.Experience with MVC frameworks.Familiarity with Agile/Scrum.Familiarity with Version Control Systems (Git).Experience with testing and continuous integration platforms: Selenium, PHPUnit, Jenkins.Linux skills and experience with networking equipment is a plusFrom personal point of view:A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea winExceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracyBasic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plusBasic German is a plusOur offerThe opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy sharesMotivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things doneOpen discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your workBright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of BerlinFlexible working hoursPermanent contract
