company: De Causmaecker & Partner / Schütze Consulting AG
role: Java-Entwickler / Java Developer at De Causmaecker & Partner / Schütze Consulting AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Karriereperspektive für überzeugende Persönlichkeit Kommunikationsstarker Software-EntwicklerJava-Entwickler (m,w)Java Developer (m,w)Übernahme von Verantwortung im Rahmen von SW-EntwicklungsprojektenErfolgreiche IT-Beratung  Gute Work-Life-BalanceBerlinHaben Sie Ihr Studium erfolgreich abgeschlossen? Z.B. in einem Bereich der Informatik, Natur- oder Ingenieurswissenschaften? Oder haben Sie sich in der Praxis gleichwertige Kenntnisse angeeignet? Können Sie auf solide Berufserfahrungen zurückblicken? Haben Sie bereits erfolgreich Java implementiert und kennen die gängigen Tools und Software-Architekturen? Möchten Sie nun ihre mehrjährigen Kenntnisse in Digitalisierungsprojekteneingeben? Gehören darüber hinaus Dynamik und Verhandlungsgeschick ebenso zu Ihren Stärken wie Analytik und Pragmatismus? Und sind Sie ein ausgesprochen guter Kommunikator? Dann lesen Sie bitte weiter:Die Schütze Consultant AG als mittelständische, inhabergeführte, wachstumsstarke IT-Beratung mit ca. 80 Mitarbeitern gehört seit über fünfzehn Jahren zu den Hidden Champions. Wir haben uns auf Beratung (eRechnung, ePayment), Entwicklung und Betrieb sowie Digitalisierung fokussiert und sind in den Branchen Öffentlicher Dienst (eGovernment), Finanzen, Bildung, Soziales und Gesundheitswesen aktiv. Unsere Unternehmenskultur ist geprägt durch eine positive, transparente Atmosphäre in der Teamgeist, Authentizität und das Wohl jedes Einzelnen berücksichtigt werden. Wir wachsen weiter und bieten Ihnen deshalb beste Karrierechancen in einem spannenden Umfeld.Nach einer fokussierten Einarbeitung übernehmen Sie eigenverantwortlich Entwicklungsaufgaben, teilweise vor Ort beim Kunden, teilweise in den Räumlichkeiten unseres Mandanten Hierzu gehört neben dem Management der Kundenbeziehung, auch die Beobachtung und Adaptierung neuer technologischer Entwicklungen. Die Ausschöpfung von Cross Selling-Potentialen bei Bestandskunden sowie die Akquisition von Nachfolgeaufträgen runden Ihr Aufgabenportfolio ab. Möchten Sie sich dieser Herausforderung stellen? Und haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?Dann rufen Sie unseren Berater, Herrn Matthias Kohl, unter +49 69 666 82 12 an. Gerne auch abends und am Wochenende unter +49 170 555 49 78. Er beantwortet Ihnen erste Fragen und informiert Sie über die weitere Vorgehensweise. Oder Sie senden direkt eine E-Mail an mk@houseofconsultants.de unter Angabe der Kennziffer MK7045.

role: Technomathematikerin / Technomathematikers oder Informatikerin / Informatikers at Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Physikalisch-Technische BundesanstaltBraunschweig und BerlinNationales MetrologieinstitutDie Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt (PTB) ist das nationale Metrologie-Institut der Bundesrepublik Deutschland mit wissenschaftlich-technischen Dienstleistungsaufgaben und fördert Fortschritt und Zuverlässigkeit in der Messtechnik für Gesellschaft, Wirtschaft und Wissenschaft.In dem Präsidialen Stab der PTB ist zum frühestmöglichen Zeitpunkt die Stelle einer/einesTechnomathematikerin / Technomathematikers oderInformatikerin / Informatikerszu besetzen. Die Stelle ist auf 2 Jahre befristet. Bei Bewährung ist die Übernahme in ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis möglich. Es kommen nur Bewerber/innen in Frage, die bisher in keinem Arbeitsverhältnis zum Bund gestanden haben bzw. deren Ausscheiden aus einem Arbeitsverhältnis zum Bund mehr als drei Jahre zurückliegt. Die Vergütung erfolgt nach Entgeltgruppe 11 TVöD Bund. Der Dienstort ist Berlin.Die Stabsgruppe PSt1 „Koordination Digitalisierung" ist zum einen für die Koordinierung strategischer Vorhaben in der PTB im Bereich Digitalisierung zuständig und führt zum anderen eigenständige Forschungs- und Entwicklungsarbeiten in disziplinübergreifenden Querschnittsthemen der Digitalisierung durch.Aufgaben:Durchführung optischer Simulationsrechnungen auf Basis der an der PTB entwickelten Simulationssoftware SimOptDevice (Matlab)Entwicklung graphischer Benutzeroberflächen und Programmdokumentationen (Matlab und Python)Unterstützung bei der Implementierung von an der PTB entwickelten Auswerte-, Analyse- und Simulationsmethoden für die Metrologie in der digitalen Signalverarbeitung und für verteilte Messsysteme (Python)Unterstützung bei der Durchführung von weiteren Forschungsaktivitäten der Stabsgruppe PSt1 „Koordination Digitalisierung"Anforderungsprofil:abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Diplom (FH) oder Bachelor) der Fachrichtung Technomathematik oder vergleichbar (Informatik oder Mathematik)Erfahrung bei der Implementierung komplexer Lösungen in Matlab oder PythonKenntnisse in der Bild- und Wellenoptik und/oder Kenntnisse in der digitalen Signalverarbeitung und Systemtheorie sind von Vorteilsehr gute Kommunikations- und TeamfähigkeitKreativität, hohe Lernbereitschaft, großes Engagement, Verlässlichkeit und Fähigkeit zur selbständigen Arbeit werden erwartetsehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Englisch in Wort und SchriftBereitschaft, sich schnell in neue Themengebiete sowie neue Entwicklungen einzuarbeitenBereitschaft zur Reisetätigkeit im In- und AuslandDie PTB fördert die berufliche Gleichstellung von Frauen und Männern und ist deshalb besonders an Bewerbungen von Frauen interessiert.Die PTB bietet im Rahmen der dienstlichen Möglichkeiten flexible Teilzeitmodelle an, um insbesondere die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf zu unterstützen.Schwerbehinderte Bewerber/innen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.Sind Sie interessiert?Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung. Bitte nutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungsformularoder bewerben Sie sich auf dem Postweg:Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt-Institut Berlin-Kennziffer 17-39-PStAbbestraße 2-1210587 BerlinDie Bewerbungsfrist endet am 30. September 2017.Bitte haben Sie Verständnis dafür, dass wir Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht entgegennehmen.Weitere fachliche Informationen zu dieser Stelle erhalten Sie bei Herrn Dr. T. Kleine-Ostmann, Tel.: +49 531 592-1008, E-Mail: thomas.kleine-ostmann@ptb.de oderHerrn Dr. S. Eichstädt, Tel.: +49 30 3481-7946, E-Mail: sascha.eichstaedt@ptb.de.Link zum FachbereichWir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung.Informationen über unser Haus entnehmen Sie bitte unserer Internetseite: www.ptb.de.

role: Full-Stack Softwareentwickler (m/w) at Hypoport AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Die Hypoport AG ist Muttergesellschaft der Hypoport-Gruppe. Die Tochterunternehmen der Gruppe befassen sich mit dem Vertrieb von Finanzdienstleistungen, ermöglicht oder unterstützt durch Finanz-Technologie (FinTech). Die Tochterunternehmen sind in die vier voneinander profitierenden Geschäftsbereiche Kreditplattform, Privatkunden, Institutionelle Kunden und Versicherungsplattform gegliedert.So spannend wie ein Start-up, so solide wie eine Bank - du suchst diese Kombination? Mit Scrum, Test Driven Development, Pair Programming und eigenen Clean Code Vorgaben entwickelst und gestaltest Du in unserem Entwickler-Team mit neuen Technologien und modernen Vorgehensmodellen. Professionell, aber in einem entspannten Umfeld.Was tun wir?Wir entwickeln neue Anwendungen und erweitern unsere bestehenden Software-Produkte.Dazu zählen dynamische Inhalte auf unseren beiden Webportalen drklein.de und Vergleich.de, wie z.B. die Rechner, Vergleiche und Antragsstrecken.Unsere weiteren Produkte sind das Reporting-System, mit dem die Berater von Dr. Klein ihren Erfolg messen können, und das Feedback-System, mit dem Kunden von Dr. Klein ihre Berater bewerten können.Wir treiben die Entwicklung dieser Systeme von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Betrieb voran – und das alles innerhalb eines Teams – ganz im Sinne der Vollfunktionalität.Welche Technologien nutzen wir?Wir sprechen hauptsächlich Java und JavaScript.Unterstützung erhalten wir durch Guice, Jersey, SASS, AngularJS und jQuery. Wir nutzen SQL- und Mongo-Datenbanken.Wann passt Du zu uns?Wenn du dich in unseren Technologien wiederfindest und darin schon mehrjährige Erfahrung gesammelt hast.Wenn du auf Clean Code und TDD stehst.Wenn Pair Programming und Teamverantwortung für dich eine gute Idee sind.Wenn dich Full-Stack-Entwicklung reizt. Wenn du in einem agilen Umfeld arbeiten möchtest.Wenn du kein Einzelkämpfer, sondern ein Teamplayer bist. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen mit uns zu teilen und zu vermehren.Warum sind wir so gerne dabei?Wir arbeiten eng mit Kollegen aus den Fachbereichen zusammen. Flexible Arbeitszeiten und agile Vorgehensweise ermöglichen es uns, entspannt zu gestalten. Wir tauschen uns regelmäßig mit anderen Kollegen aus und nehmen an Teamevents und After-Work-Partys teil. Über die Arbeit hinaus gibt es Sportangebote, Interessencommunitys, Rückenkurs, Massage und weitere Extras für das Wohlbefinden. Wenn die Luft raus ist, finden sich immer Kollegen für Kicker, Billard oder Tischtennis.Und jetzt?Bewirb Dich bei uns!Bei Fragen wende dich an:Justus BreitmeierPeople & Organisation PartnerTel. +49 30/ 42086 1917Hypoport AG | Dr. Klein Privatkunden AG Klosterstraße 71, 10179 Berlinwww.hypoport.de | www.drklein.deJetzt bewerben

role: Data Scientist - Payments at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
description: You Are Ready To Make an ImpactAt Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.You Are Setting StandardsVariety. As a team you will research, design and implement machine learning algorithms to improve our payment solutions.Ownership. You will be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment.Excellence. Share your knowledge and passion about delivering scalable real-world machine learning solutions to end users, and help your colleagues excel.You Are SkilledTechnologies. You have already worked with big data frameworks before (we use Apache Spark). You are eager to prototype new machine learning concepts (in R or Python) and are also able to push them all the way to production. You also have experience building production systems at scale (experience in Scala or Java is a plus).You have experience in applied machine learning and know at least one of the following methods in depth (regression, tree-based methods, ensemble learning). And you have a good understanding of the mathematical concepts that are frequently used in machine learning (linear algebra, probability theory)Code Quality. You are ready to deploy your code to production (including testing, CI, deployment) and taking ownership.Education. You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or another similar quantitative field (PhD, M.Sc.) and are eager to keep learning and applying new knowledge.You Are OfferedCulture. A workplace where trust, empowerment and feedback are valued; positive, inspiring working atmosphere.Perks. Competitive salary; great shopping discount on a wide range of products on zalando.com; discounts from external partners; office in the heart of Berlin; public transport discounts; relocation assistance for internationals; municipality services; flexible working times; family service and parent & child rooms*; additional holidays and volunteering time off; diverse sports and health offerings*. (*Depending on location)Development. Mentoring; personal branding support focused on leadership; diverse career opportunities.Peers. International, accomplished experts.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring process, please contact our recruiter Maria Garcia

role: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
description: Wayfair’s Front-End Engineering team is responsible for bridging the gap between Design and Back-End Programming on an Engineering team of 1000+ and a family of sites that sees over 55 million visitors per month, which generate more than $3.5 billion/year.  Through the translation of mockups into scalable and maintainable coding patterns across six primary brands and three international sites, we work closely with Design and Full-Stack Engineers to maintain the company’s visual web standards within our codebase. We build all of our features using a combination of React and SASS. However, it's not only about the tools. We have complex business logic and a lot of building blocks, which sometimes require heavy lifting and we use Redux to handle that complexity.We’re looking for a talented Frontend Engineer, who knows how to balance a passion for logic and problem solving with a keen eye for design to join this growing team.Projects include:      Writing clean, elegant, accessible, and performant Javascript, HTML, and CSS code in support of our 6 E-commerce sites, internal applications and supplier extranet.      Problem solving on the fly using various resources and debugging methods to diagnose and execute solutions independently.      Working seamlessly with Designers, Product Managers, and business stakeholders to translate designs/wireframes into frontend code.      Working closely with other Storefront technology teams including Frontend Platforms, Performance, and Full-Stack (PHP) to create next generation site features.      Understanding and employing engineering and optimization best practices with regard to frontend web standards, code maintainability, page rendering, and browser performance.An ideal candidate has:1-3+ years of Javascript, CSS, and HTML development experienceSense of humor and excellent communication skillsSkilled with CSS and HTML, including the ability to code from scratch without a framework, and a focus on code reusability, performance, and faithfulness to designSkilled with Javascript, including familiarity with preferably React or other modern client-side frameworks such as Backbone.js, Angular, Ember, or Polymer.Nice to haves:Github accountInvolved in meet-ups and conferencesExperience with/knowledge of frontend coding considerations for Mobile/Tablet devices, including responsive/adaptive designExperience with React in particularPHP or other server-side language exposureSource Control exposureExperience working on large, complex, enterprise level sites, ideally with multiple “skins” for the same markupA Creative/Design background with an instinct for UI/UXAnd finally, our proposition to you!Of course the usual competitive salary, bonus and we share the company with you in stock unitsWe contribute to your gym membership and offer free Yoga classes, as well as Wellness Weeks with massages, workshops and other exciting eventsThe opportunity to work cross-functionally and closely with senior leadership not only in the Berlin office, but also with Boston, London and GalwayWe offer a vast selection of classes through our learn@work program to enhance your professional and personal development.We want you to connect with your team and fellow colleagues through regular social eventsWe’re in the heart of the Berlin startup scene with lots of space to encourage collaboration and teamworkAbout WayfairWayfair (NYSE: W) offers an extensive selection of home furnishings and décor across all styles and price points with a superior customer service and inspiring interior topics. With an unparalleled selection of more than seven million home items from 7,000 suppliers, Wayfair helps people find the perfect product at the right price. Always committed to using technology to create a superior shopping experience, Wayfair developed Wayfair Next which concentrates on 3D visualization technologyWayfair generated $3.6 billion in net revenue for the twelve months ended March 31, 2017. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with operations throughout North America and Europe, the company employs more than 5,700 people.

role: JavaScript Developer at KNIME (Berlin, Germany)
description: Who are we?We are looking for the right people to join our well-funded, growing open-source startup and to help us to continue to build exciting technology that makes KNIME users happy. KNIME Analytics Platform is popular both with its large and enthusiastic user community as well as IT analysts, who regularly place us in their leaders category  next to some very surprised industry dinosaurs, btw. But we are most proud of the consistently high marks we get for user satisfaction. Our open secret: we are transforming the data-science landscape by providing an open source (and free) platform that lets data scientists mix and match the tools and methods they want while helping enterprises responsibly integrate advanced analytics into their operations. In this way, KNIME helps organizations nurture new user populations that want to exploit the benefits of data science and advanced analytics while remaining strongly committed to open source.Who are you?You like to develop visualizations to help others understand and explore data and have a good amount of experience working with JavaScript frameworks like D3 that are used for building modern interactive visualizations. You have good sense of what it means to make a visualization eye catching without sacrificing usability. Ideally you also have some experience writing java code to massage the (possibly large) data into the right format. If you have a background in doing data analytics / data science thatd even be better, but if not youll learn it.Whats the job?The areas at KNIME you could be working in are manifold. However, you would start by migrating some of the visualization components in KNIME Analytics Platform to JavaScript. That may sound like reworking an existing codebase but its mostly about writing new code  except that we have a bunch of examples to learn from/be inspired by. To get some idea of what this means have look at one of Christians blog posts (though we doubt that he really did it in 10 minutes). This could easily keep you busy for a long, long time but depending on your interest and (our) priorities you might also work on improving the KNIME Webportal, which combines all these standalone views into a powerful application, or -- to take this a bit further -- work with the team bringing the whole KNIME application into the browser. You would be closely working with Oleg, Christian, Greg and Bernd but also be in touch with a lot more folks as in the end your work is of high interest to not only the company but the entire KNIME community.We are looking for someone to join us in one of our offices in Berlin or Konstanz. Though were happy to have applicants from farther away, we are not offering relocation benefits for this position.

role: Senior Node.JS Developer (f/m) Urban Mobility at car2go (Berlin, Germany)
description: Who we areAs the first free-floating car sharing system in the world, car2go offers flexible mobility with smart fortwo and Mercedes-Benz vehicles, everywhere and at any time for a reasonable price in the inner city areas of various cities. Vehicles can be located and booked spontaneously via smartphone app or the internet portal. Your roleYou will play a key role within the web development team and shape the backend of the car2go eco-system. You will write code for web based automated systems to analyze and process high volumes of data in ‘real-time’. Fast prototyping and bulletproofed production applications are both epics.You constantly improve the architecture and performance of our highly available backend applications and respective APIsYou will write well tested, modular, documented codeYou research for new technologies and you are happy to learn new ones that improve our productsYou will closely collaborate with our multiple Backend- and mobile App-TeamsYou will work with other software engineers in a self-organized scrum teamSkills and requirementsYou have several years of professional experience with backend development in Javascript and Node.jsYou have an outstanding understanding of Node.js and used frameworks like hapi in productionYou have up-to-date skills in Javascript (ES6 or Typescript)You’ve built RESTful APIs and micro-services beforeYou have good skills in test-driven and behavior-driven developmentKnowledge of the usual cloud systems like AWS or IBM Softlayer is a plusThe teamAs a self-organized and agile team we work collaboratively to solve challenging problems of the fast developing web technology. We are an international team of experts which supports direct communication and a hands-on culture. Our spirit is determined by a pioneering footprint and we foster the contribution of your own ideas and research.One part of the team will be located in Hamburg, the other one in Berlin. You can choose your operation site freely.The recruitment processWhen you have applied successfully, you’ll be invited for a phone interview with one of our experienced tech recruiters.If our recruiter believes you are suitable for the role, you will be asked for a Skype interview with the project’s technical lead.The last stage includes a face to face interview at our office in Berlin or Hamburg, depending on your current location. This is usually with the technical lead, one of our developers and an HR manager.

role: Full Stack Development for new Fintech Startup at Moonfare GmbH (Berlin, Germany)

role: Senior Security Software Engineer (Java or Scala, FinTech) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)

You will identify and resolve security issues and include security analysis, defenses and countermeasures at each phase of the software development lifecycle to result in a robust software. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others' projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand-while receiving meaningful support at every step.Your responsibilitiesImplement, test and operate software security techniques in compliance with technical reference architecturePerform on-going security-testing and code review to improve software securityConsult team members on secure coding practicesAdvocate Zalando´s security principles and a general "security mindset" in the teamsExplain how and why a particular security incident happenedPropose viable, informed solutions to fix security problems that ariseGain a firm understanding of the security domains and understand how the apply at every stage of software developmentMaintain technical documentationProvide engineering designs for new software solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilitiesWhat we are looking forUniversity degree in Informatics, Computer Science or a related fieldProven professional track-record in software security analysis and the security fieldPayment, banking or financial background a strong plusUnderstanding of payment or other sensible processesDeep software development experience in programming languages like Java and/or ScalaStrong interest in all aspects of security research and developmentKnowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web servicesWillingness to stay current on security topicsEngagement with the security team to discuss new tools and exchange best practicesA bit of charisma - you can make security cool and funEnglish language fluencyWhat you can expect from usOne-month mentoring programInternal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical "People Leads" who help you achieve masteryPersonal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leadersCommunity: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and moreCompetitive salary40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discountRelocation assistance for internationalsAbout ZalandoZalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, operating in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires fast movers - with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams - and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It's how we grow.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Emily Nguyen.

applications.Experience in Java and/ or Golang would be a plus.You understand the benefit of automated tests and actively embrace it.You have experience operating in sensitive production environments.You are comfortable discussing not just IAM impact, risks, vulnerabilities and threats but also explain basic OAuth 2.0 to a variety of audiences.What you can expect from usOne-month mentoring programInternal tech talks, skills-building courses and Practice Leads who help you achieve masteryPersonal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with internationalsAbout ZalandoZalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. role: iOS Developer at Tillhub GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: We are disrupting an entire industry. In 2017 more than 50% of the retailers need a new cash register. We are building the most mobile-native way to manage stores: meet Tillhub. We are are an award winning team consisting of experienced entrepreneurs and software developers. Based in Berlin, we have already acquired many very promising clientsiOS DeveloperNow it is time for us and you to grow our team even further. We are looking for a talented, passionate, and resourceful iOS developer who shares our vision and wants to build something exciting and fresh. Our vision is to create a much better point of sale and help retailers to win in their businesses in the 21st century.Your profileYou are a passionate engineer who loves to write clear, well designed and reusable codeYou are an excellent iOS-Developer with outstanding skills in Swift, well knowing Objective-CYou gained at least 3 years of experience in the implementation of professional mobile projectsYou are an enthusiast for technical challenges tweaking the use of third-party APIs and SDKs to maximum stabilityYou work well inside a team with a strong sense for quality in an agile environmentYou have extended experience with Core Data, UIKit, concurrency handling and synchronization of sensitive data via REST-APIs. You are familiar with Unit- and UITests mainly inside XcodeExperience with complex application architecture and database design is highly preferred, knowledge of other SQL-databases is a plusYour role  You will be an essential part of a small team of iOS-developers. In close collaboration with the backend engineers you will help building the Tillhub-application for iPads. New features are waiting for your implementation.Tasks will be planned together with the whole IT-team. You take responsibility in executing them - giving and receiving feedback along the process. We will always help each other to create the best product possible.Flexibility is a very important factor to satisfy our customers and win new ones. Still we favor maintainability and extensibility over shortcuts - even if we admit that they are sometimes necessary. With your input also planning and documentation will improve.We use Jira and Confluence, Slack, GitHub, Fabric and CocoaPods.We aim to replace the majority of the remaining Objective-C legacy code and are looking forward to Swift 4.We offerBased in Berlin Kreuzberg, you will be part of our fine international team and shape the success of Tillhub. Your work has direct and noticeable impact on our product. Regular internal tech talks, skill-building events, as well as retrospectives will help you achieve mastery with us. We believe in flat hierarchies, limited meetings and fast honest talk. A monthly feedback day will help you receive valuable feedback from your peers and supervisors. Having awesome team events and a feeling that you change people’s lives all day long complete our offer. In our new and modern office in Kreuzberg, you will be provided with fruits, drinks, fancy chairs and a nice view to our newly built garden.We are looking forward to meet you!

role: OpenStack Cloud System Engineer (m/f) at SysEleven GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Would you be interested in harnessing over 4,000 CPUs, 35 TB RAM and more than 800 TB storage to take an OpenStack cloud to the next level? Then you’ve come to the right place.As a System Engineer for SysEleven, you will work with committed and passionate people to manage and develop an OpenStack public cloud. We need to tackle the challenges we face in an effective, efficient and highly technical way. What makes our cloud so special is that it complies with the relevant standards: we attract customers with our performance rather than locking them in. To stay constantly up to speed, we undergo regular training in all manner of different areas, including international conferences.Your tasks:Design, manage and develop our OpenStack cloud platformAutomate at all levels, from bare metal through to application managementKeep track of everything through good monitoring, alerting and trendingEvaluate and commission software and hardware, e.g. SDN, SDS and OpenStack components such as Designate and KollaOffer new ideas to improve our processes and architectureJoin the on-call rotation and help solve emergencies should they ariseRequirements:Several years of experience managing distributed systems with LinuxMonitoring and trending experience, e.g. with Prometheus and GrafanaExperience of configuration management, e.g. with AnsibleAttention to detailAbility to stay calm while solving critical incidentsBonus: Experience with software-defined storage and/or software-defined networking e.g. Open vSwitch or CEPHBonus: Experience with Kubernetes and/or Docker

role: QA Automation Engineer at Signavio (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: What we offer:So what’s the team like? What started as a university project has grown organically over the last seven years into a distinctly international crew. We keep things open, agile and communicative, with pair programming widely practiced and encouraged. It is all based on trust – no micromanaging, no distributed teams, no nearshoring, no offshoring – face to face communication is premium. That is why the whole development team is located together in one office in beautiful Berlin!We are constantly evolving and looking to integrate new technologies in our technology stack. We currently:Version with GitBuild with Gradle and WebpackWrite Java 8 and ECMAScript 6 codeManage with NPMTest with TestNG, Selenium, Mocha and KarmaAutomate with JenkinsUtilize React and ReduxOrganize with Scrum and KanbanYou are free to use the OS and IDE of your choice, the tooling you are comfortable with and setup your workspace the way you like it.Our engineers are self-organized within their teams, working on components and independent projects together and closely with product managers and UX designers. We value your thoughts and ideas and will give you the freedom to push and implement them.We get that balancing a family and work can be a challenge, so everyone (family or no family) gets flexible work hours. Work when you work best.We support personal growth, both in and outside of the company. You will gain – and share – knowledge during recurring learning lunches, jours fixes, pizza sessions and our annual code camp.How you will contribute:We are looking for a QA Automation Expert to strengthen our development team in Berlin. You will help to continue to develop and improve our leading cloud-based business process modeling, decision modeling and workflow software.Specifically you will:Drive the QA automation topic at SignavioDiscover the requirements of the development and elaborate solutionsDevelop and enhance automated quality assurance processes during development, test, deployment and operations phase (continuous integration)Improve our test frameworks for backend (Java) as well as frontend (JavaScript) testingReview the work of your teammatesThis is you:Solid experience in automating development processes and testsDeep knowledge in working with Jenkins and SeleniumExperience in the following programming languages and technologies: Java, JavaScript, Gradle, Tomcat, JSON, XML, TestNG, JBehaveBasic knowledge of database systems like MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle, IBM DB2Basic experience in using code coverage (jacoco, cobertura) and code analysis tools (FindBugs, Sonar)A degree in an IT-related areaThe motivation to work in an agile environmentThe drive to understand the needs of our customersExperience in using GitVery good communication skills in English, German is a plusBeing part of a motivated team with flat hierarchies you know the importance of communication and feedback. You are appreciated for your engagement, your constructive input and your relentless drive to improve yourself, the product, and the company.What we value most:Be creative and innovative: Push ideas to create a product that our customers love to use, and minimize complexity.Be passionate and create impact: Create amazing work and inspire others with your results.Work independently and responsibly: Take responsibility for your own actions and think about your tasks.Communicate and build trust: Communication is key to achieving our goals efficiently.Be honest and selfless: Admit your own mistakes, be open to feedback, and make time to help your colleagues.

role: Senior Software Developer für mailbox.org at Heinlein Support GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: "Mit Kompetenz und Engagement arbeiten wir am sichersten Provider der Welt" lautet die Vision, die sich unser Team von derzeit rund 35 Kollegen an unserem Standort Berlin-Prenzlauer Berg gegeben hat. Teilen Sie unsere Vision? Dann machen Sie mit -- beim Testsieger der Stiftung Warentest.Für unsere E-Mail-Provider mailbox.org und ox.io und unseren Geschäftsbereich Heinlein Hosting suchen wir Softwareentwickler (m/w) für unsere Webinterfaces und API-Backends, die gerne Verantwortung übernehmen. Besonders für folgende Arbeitsprofile:Softwarearchitektur in PHP und JavaScriptMicroservicesContinous Integration und DeploymentAufbau einer hochskalierenden Plattform für <n> Millionen NutzerIhr AufgabenfeldWir entwickeln Kommunikations- und Sicherheitssoftware für unsere Plattformen und benötigen einen erfahrenen Programmierer für Planung, Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung der passenden Benutzerschnittstellen und zugehörigen Backend-Funktionen. Die Sicherstellung einer hohen Code-Qualität durch Reviews, Unit-Tests und Refactorings gehört genauso zu Ihrem Aufgabenfeld, wie die Analyse und Behebung von Fehlern und Anpassung der Applikation. Sie arbeiten in einem charmanten Team von 5 bis 6 Entwicklern + Teamleitung, unterstützt durch Scrum-Coaching und Projektmanager, sowie durch die Systemadministratoren unserer Plattformen. Ihr Hauptauftraggeber sind unsere Produkt-Teams und Projektmanager aus unserem Haus.Ihr ProfilSehr gute Kenntnisse in PHP und JavaScript (Angular)Arbeitsfähig in Python und bashHTML und CSS (LESS/SASS) gehören für Sie zum AlltagswortschatzSie beherrschen einen strukturierten Programmierstil und koordinieren sich gut im TeamIm Bedarfsfall gehen Sie mit Kunden und Geschäftspartnern sicher und vertrauensvoll umStreben nach steter Steigerung der Code-Qualität durch agile ArbeitsmethodenInteresse an permanenter Fortbildung und EntwicklungGute Deutsch-Kenntnisse, gute Englisch-KenntnisseZusatzqualifikationen (nicht zwingend erforderlich)Sie können mit Linux umgehenSie haben Erfahrung mit MicroservicesSinnhaftigkeit, Teamarbeit & FlexibilitätSinnvolles Arbeiten: Sie sind wesentlich daran beteiligt, mailbox.org zum sichersten E-Mail-Anbieter der Welt auszubauen und so auch in Zukunft eine sichere und freie Kommunikation zwischen unseren Kunden zu ermöglichen. Außerdem unterstützen Sie unseren seit 1989 existierenden ISP JPBerlin.de mit seinen sozial- und politisch engagierten Kunden und Organisationen sowie unsere Geschäftskunden bei Heinlein Hosting. - Wir bieten also einen vielfältigen, interessanten und verantwortungsvollen Arbeitsplatz.Ein tolles Team: Sie arbeiten in einem kollegialen Team mitten in Berlin. Eigeninitiative und Mitdenken werden bei uns besonders unterstützt -- auf offene Kommunikation und Kollegialität legen wir großen Wert. Mindestens zwei Teamevents im Jahr und eine wöchentliche Mittags-Kochrunde freuen alle Kollegen, die dabei sein wollen.Lebenslanges Lernen: Unsere hauseigene Heinlein Akademie lockt mit spannenden Fortbildungen Admins aus ganz Europa nach Berlin – und bietet für uns selbst natürlich ebenso zahlreiche Möglichkeiten, Neues zu erlernen und Vorhandenes zu vertiefen.Sehr gute Rahmenbedingungen: Flexibilität in der Arbeitszeit für die Verbindung von Familie und Beruf sind für uns selbstverständlich. Ein angemessenes Gehalt, Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Freizeitausgleich, wenn es mal hoch her ging, gehören für uns genauso dazu wie eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre, frisches Obst und unser Masseur, der einmal die Woche vorbeikommt.Ihre BewerbungWir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Gehaltsvorstellung). Diese richten Sie bitte ausschließlich per E-Mail mit PDF/JPG-Anhängen (keine MS-Word-Dokumente) an jobs@heinlein-support.de.Ihr Ansprechpartner bei Fragen ist der Teamleiter der Developer, Yan Minagawa. Sie erreichen ihn telefonisch unter: 030 / 405051-60.

role: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) at Wayfair Europe (Berlin, Germany)
description: At Wayfair, we are looking to grow our Site Reliability Engineering team by bringing on board a talented Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) to help manage the large scale physical and virtual server environment that underpins our global e-commerce platform. Though the focus of this team is Linux, due to the nature of our platforms you will be involved with and exposed to a wide variety of systems. This team owns a large portion of our customer facing systems and services, and as such are heavily involved in the architecture, growth, and improvement of our various platforms. Ever wondered what it would like to work at ‘internet scale’? At Wayfair we are dealing with internet scale challenges on a daily basis. With our traffic doubling year over year consistently we are faced with some pretty exciting and interesting challenges!Some projects the team is currently working on in 2017:Create and improve tools to aid in monitoring and control of our systemsEnhance our infrastructure to support a variety of different disaster recovery optionsExpansion of current physical data centersMigrating targeted applications, sites, systems to cloud platformsImproving automation of systems, processes, and servicesLooking to the future - containers? Mesos?Responsibilities include:Taking POC Systems and preparing them for production use by applying our standards to them and making them immutableProvide the highest level of technical escalation within the organization of our critical production platformsImprove security and performance of infrastructureAutomate, Automate, AutomateProvide Architecture & Design feedback for all production platforms, as well as for other teams with in the organizationProactively monitor systems to anticipate business needs before they become critical pathThinking of what is the next big infrastructure thingQualifications:5+ Years experience in a SRE/DevOps type roleExperience managing Linux in a large scale environmentExperience working with Linux automation tools, such as Puppet, Chef, etc.Knowledge of Web Servers (Apache/Nginx)Familiarity with load balancing tools and techniques (HAProxy, etc)Experience working in virtualized environmentsExperience working with Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)Scripting ability particularly in Bash, PHP, Python or RubyOther traits we look for:Good interpersonal and team building skillsAn easy-going attitude and sense of humorA positive, people-oriented and energetic attitudeA strong drive to learn and try new thingsAn analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problemsAn interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and having fun while doing it

role: Senior AI Architect (JVM, Machine & Deep Learning) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description: You Are Ready To Make An ImpactAs Zalando transforms from a pure online retailer to a fashion platform, we bring fashion competency and branding expertise to the game by connecting all the players in the industry: consumers, stylists, designers, brands, influencers, and, online and offline stores. By providing a bold mix of global brands, local designers and specialist labels, we create fresh concepts, high-impact campaigns, smart applications and innovative partnerships. We are now searching for a Senior AI Architect to join our Search & Personalisation department. In this role, you will create an overarching AI strategy and drive our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.  You Are Setting StandardsVision. You'll define the strategy and roadmap for analytics, deep learning frameworks, and pioneer the vision to the organization.Implementation. As part of a growing, multi-disciplinary team of Data Scientists and Research Engineers you'll build AI architecture and develop solutions to reinforce the value of data and analytics.Hands-on. You'll provide hands-on support to complex business and technology piloting projects in order to apply theory to solve real-world problems.Mission. You'll cultivate and disperse knowledge and best practices on AI architecture and design development within the engineering team.Ownership.You'll be the owner of Zalando's Global AI architecture documentation and ensure its consistency and alignment with various engineering stakeholders.Team play. You'll embrace architecture development as a collective effort and share your knowledge through coaching, peer reviews, articles, and tech talks. You ArePassionate about Deep Learning. You are a proud PhD degree holder in Computer Science, Computer Architecture, Deep Learning or a related field. Experienced (on a senior level). You can impress us with 12+ years of professional hands-on experience as a (senior) engineer and architect. Your experience is derived from distributed large scale applications requiring research integrations, such as search and personalization or price forecasting systems.Polyglot. You bring an expert level programming skills with Java and JVM based languages, like Scala, and ideally Python.Skilled. You have experience in one or more of the following areas: artificial intelligence, large-scale data mining and machine learning, (including a solid understanding of DL fundamentals).Enthusiastic about solving hard business problems. You love data and analytics in balance with open source technologies.Armed with soft skills. Your effective communication skills paired with your strong analytical competence allows you to simplify complex information and problems.  You Will Benefit FromCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours. Want To Join Us?If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact us via email: Magdalena Masluk-Meller.

role: Engineering Manager for Wikidata & Wikipedia at Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Wikimedia Deutschland – Gesellschaft zur Förderung Freien Wissens e. V. is a non-profit organisation based in Berlin, Germany. With more than 80 employees and about 50.000 members, it is the oldest and largest of more than 40 independent chapters of the international Wikimedia movement. The most well-known Wikimedia project, the free online encyclopedia Wikipedia, is used by millions of people across the world every day and is continuously updated and improved by millions of users.Wikimedia Deutschland furthers these ideals even beyond the free encyclopedia: It is our aim to establish and promote the creation, collection, and distribution of free knowledge in all parts of society. Our objective is to create a world in which the sum of all human knowledge is freely accessible for everyone. The main focus of our activities is the support of volunteers, the development of technology and software, public education, and cooperation with cultural and scientific institutions. We grant scholarships to volunteers working for Wikimedia projects and we provide technical support. On both the national and EU-level, we are advocating a legal framework which allows for free knowledge to become part of our everyday life.Engineering Manager at Wikimedia Deutschland e.V. support engineers and designers who build features, products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. As experienced and hands-on Engineering Manager you enable our communities to achieve our Vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.You will join our Software Development Department where we work on Wikidata, a free collaborative, free licenced database to store the knowledge of the world. We also developing technical products & features for the german speaking Wikipedia. You’ll supporting teams that work on exciting open source technologies like the Wikidata Query Service. Our Software Engineers working on ambitious projects like Wikidata, the Technical Wishlist and the local Fundraising.As an Engineering Manager, we’d like you to do these thingsOrganize teams to be effective in meeting their goalsDevelop goals and track progress publicly and collaborativelyRepresent team members within the organization and publiclyCoordinate with other teams and departments and take care of agile engineering processesSupport your team’s members to develop their individual career pathsRecruit and hire new team membersWrite code for our products and projects with our Developers and EngineersWhat we are offering youWe have internal presentations by our developers on topics they are enthusiastic aboutYou can attend local user groups during work time and you are encouraged to do soYou will have a noticeable impact on one of the top four visited websites in the worldWe regularly go to conferences, both as attendees and participantsOur development teams are cross-functional, self-organizing and highly autonomous. No single team leaders or middle management. You’ll be working directly with the product owner. Among other things, testing, refactoring, and pair programming are encouraged. We’re constantly trying to improve the way we work.All software we develop is Open Source, and we contribute back to various projects we use. Many of our components are published in a format that allows reuse outside of our own projects.

role: 4 Senior Java Developer - bring more sun and wind to the power grid (f/m) at Younicos AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Are you keen to help shape future power supply?Are you passionate about writing clean code?Are you a team player for all aspects of the development process?Then this job is for youAs a lead Java developer at Younicos, you will work on our Y.Q platform, which monitors, supervises and controls various electrical grid connected systems like batteries, pv plants, wind farms, thermal generators, transformers, switch gears and auxiliary systems. The development of the Y.Q platform, which runs as 24/7 service on site, is based on OSGi technology and a distributed, messaging-based architecture. Specialized subsystems ensure the optimal control of the electrical components and implement technical interfaces for transmission line operators, energy providers and remote monitoring.As part of an agile team (Scrum) you will work on all aspects of the software development. Strongly modularized system architecture, documentation of the system specifications, test driven Java implementation, fully automated integration testing and building the final product are your day-to-day tasks. Depending on your skills and interests you might work on the core architecture and design of the Y.Q platform, the interface abstraction for the integration of new components, the development of algorithms, the design and development of an API for external systems to give you some ideas.All developments are performed in close collaboration with our technical engineers to understand and implement the technical requirements of the electrical equipment. With your team, you will develop the best technical solutions while having the freedom and the responsibility to bring your innovative ideas to life.Your profileFrom personal point of view:A strong focus on teamwork and a commitment to always let the best idea winExceptional attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracyBasic understanding of the principles of electrical engineering is a plusBasic German is a plusFrom the technical point of view a must isSignificant expertise in Java and experience of other higher programming languagesIntuitive understanding of software architecture and designDesire for writing and testing clean, efficient and reliable codeWelcome isExperience with OSGi, Apache Karaf and Apache Camel or similar technologiesExperience with ActiveMQ and Google Protocol Buffers or other messaging middlewareExpert knowledge of MySQL and/or time series database like TICK stack or PrometheusExperience in micro servicesExperience with BDD/TDD and test automationOur offerThe opportunity to build the technology facilitating higher renewable energy sharesMotivated, passionate colleagues who love to get things doneOpen discussion culture and the opportunity to shape every aspect of your workBright, spacious and comfortable offices in the lovely city of BerlinFlexible working hoursPermanent contract

role: Senior Backend Engineer (Kubernetes/AWS) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
description: THE OPPORTUNITYZalando is transforming from an e-commerce company into a multi-service platform that provides fashion as a service. We make it our mission to imagine and predict the infinite points of interaction between fashion and people, and develop the technology to make them possible. The 1,600+ members of Zalando Technology across our offices in Germany, Ireland and Finland build most of our 40+ platform products in-house and open source - from Smart Logistics to Brand Solutions to Payments and Warehouse Management.At the core of our platform effort is the technical infrastructure - we work with a modern, cloud-native technology stack comprised of Kubernetes, Docker, AWS and Go. We offer our infrastructure as a service to more than 200 development teams in Zalando Tech that are running their applications on our clusters. Read our Kubernetes on AWS doc to learn how we run Kubernetes on AWS in production and check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use.YOUR ROLEWorking on the line between Software Engineering and Systems EngineeringCurious and a step ahead when it comes to software trendsA natural leader who takes ownership of the team's deliveriesWilling to take responsibility for running an important part of our infrastructureWHAT WE ARE LOOKING FORProficiency in at least one high-level programming language, knowing Go is a plusIn-depth understanding of UNIX/Linux system internals and TCP/IP networkingWell-versed in scripting (Bash/Python) and infrastructure automationGood knowledge of computer science fundamentals (algorithms and data structures)A track record of running large-scale systemsKnowing containers, especially Docker, Kubernetes and AWS is a big plusCloud native mindset, including microservices, resilience and scale-outWHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM USOpen Source. We work on open source software and actively participate in the Kubernetes communityCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 100+ internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & eventsPerks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choicePersonal Development. Tour of Mastery (individual growth plan), extensive onboarding program, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferencesWork Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hoursWant to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Maria Garcia.

role: Cloud Systems Developer m/f at Cloudreach (Berlin, Germany)
description: Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak 30 languages.Our mission at Cloudreach is to "enable innovation". We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It's not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.What does the Cloud Enablement team do ?The Cloud Enablement team is responsible for implementing innovative solutions for major clients who are moving to cloud platforms, built principally within AWS and Microsoft Azure.How will you spend your days ?Adventures in developing cloud-native distributed systems, container orchestration platforms, microservice and serverless architectures, and immutable infrastructure delivery mainly in AWS or Azure.Orchestration and automation of build and deployment processes, continuous integration and application configuration management.Using automation and configuration management tooling (Puppet, Chef, Ansible) to ensure compliance and ongoing operation of large estates.Migrations of legacy workloads to transform and shape them into dynamic, resilient and scalable platforms -- helping clients to make the most of the cloud.Working with reputable clients and stakeholders to identify requirements and take these from design through to build and beyond.What kind of career progression can you expect ?You can grow into a Systems Developer Lead, a Cloud Architect or a Cloud Consultant.There are opportunities for relocation in our other cloudy hubs.How to stand out ?Passion and enthusiasm for technology and its adoption.A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar STEM subject.Software development experience and/or automation in Python, Ruby, or Go -- but talk to us if you love to hack in any language.Experience with cloud ecosystems, from requirements analysis all the way to operations in AWS or Azure.You automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn't update each one manually, right?Systems administration skills -- you'll probably prefer a command line to a GUI.Fluent in German and very good English level.What are our cloudy perks?MacBook Pro and new smartphone (you will have to choose between Galaxy or iPhone - make the right choice !)Unique 'cloudy' culture: our people are diverse, passionate and easy to work with.Enjoy our uncapped holiday policy and your birthday off.Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.Monthly meal vouchers which you can use at local restaurants and supermarkets. Enjoy, it's on us!Private medical and dental care package in addition to the German statutory health care.We kick-off every new financial year by getting together in a cool destination in Europe.

role: Full Stack Web Developer at Kialo (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Sick of the Internet Shouting Factory? Endless circular commenting threads? Trolls derailing conversations with ad hominems?So are we.Welcome to Kialo, the purpose-built tool for critical thinking, thoughtful discussion, and collaborative decision-making.After an overwhelming response to our initial launch, we are now looking to massively extend our team of highly skilled software engineers to take on the challenges of building and improving a highly scalable web app.You are thinking on your feet, always coming up with new ideas for applying technology to solve problems? You are designing and living in code? And above all that, you know how to play in a team, because only in a collaborative environment the best ideas can become a reality? In that case we invite you to show off your wizardry of JS, your command of the Python, your dark arts of Unix and to unit test the hell out of it.What we expect from you:You know either JavaScript or Python 3 by heart. Or both, all the better. Even know React and Tornado? Visit us! Pretty please with TypeScript on top!You have a strong opinion about Java, in whatever direction. We don’t use it, btw.Ain’t no SQL. But we’re fine with Postgres, if you insist. Anyway, you know how to store the data. And find it. And read it. You got the idea.You know how to work with and in the cloud.You never stop to learn. We always try out new things, so you better keep up! And we’d love to see even more ideas for even newer things from you.You will plan, design, code, debug, review, test, teach and be taught in a team. Software engineering is a group activity and you can and want to play the game how it’s meant to be played.You are passionate about software. Our team is highly skilled, and we expect no less from you. You love and breathe the code.You know what an argument is. You know how to discuss in a friendly and thoughtful way. You are not afraid to speak out your opinion. That’s what we do.What you can and should expect from us:We have a tech-stack that is fun to work with. And it’s not carved in stone. If you want to work with something else, just build a prototype and convince us.We use the tools that make us efficient. Slack, Jira, Hangouts, GitHub, IntelliJ, Jenkins to name a few. You know about better ones? Please tell us about it.We have an agile process that is tailored to what a developer needs. We do Scrum - automated tests and code reviews included.We give you all the chances to grow and step up your game.We will move to a really, really nice office in the heart of Berlin in April 2018, designed for software development right from the start. With a race track. And without noisy open floor plans. How the heck should anyone think in something like that?We offer hardware of your choosing: Lenovo, MacBook, Razer, Raspberry, you name it. And we pack a pair of funky noise cancelling headphones on top.Drinks, coffee, ice cream, sweets, fruit and at least one lunch a week for free. Ok, working with us may be a minor hazard to your healthy diet.We are the unique opportunity to build and influence a radically new, world-changing thing right at the core. We will always listen to your ideas. Promise.

role: Senior Data Engineer (FinTech, Scala, Spark, Flink & Kafka) at Zalando Payments SE & Co.KG (Berlin, Germany)
description: You Are Ready To Make An ImpactAt Zalando Payments, we are processing all financial transactions of Zalando's fashion store and other consumer facing apps. Starting with a flawless user experience in the checkout over the processing of the payments to reconciliation in the backend, we cover the entire financial process to boost conversion and deliver a competitive advantage to our customers through smart risk steering.As a Senior Data Engineer at Zalando Payments, you'll help us to shape the data infrastructure that supports our risk assessment models, responsible for processing Billions of euros every year. You'll be involved into defining the data architecture and given the freedom to select the right mix of technologies to solve whichever problems come your way. Your profileYou are experienced processing data at scale, in batches and streamsSpark, Flink, Kafka, Apache Drill and others are your tools of tradeYou are experienced with RDBMS, NoSQL databases, and have an in-depth understanding of the consistency and availability guarantees they provide.You understand the properties of large distributed systemsYou are keen on understanding the business which your systems will enable and able to balance pragmatism and visionYou Are Setting StandardsVariety. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions that possibly impact millions of customers.Autonomy. Based on our Microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.You AreSkilled. In working with production-ready code in at least one JVM language (preferably Scala) and have prior experience in the big data technology landscape. E.g. databases, No-SQL data stores, distributed systems, big data processing frameworks (preferably with Spark)Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture and encouraging knowledge sharing.Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the customer experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.You Benefit FromCulture. You design, develop, deploy, operate and improve important software solutions that possibly impact millions of customers.Autonomy. Based on our Microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.You AreSkilled. In working with Java 8 or Scala and relational as well as NoSQL databases. You understand the properties of large distributed systems. Experience or knowledge in a stream processing frameworks such as Flink, Spark Streaming, Samza, etc.Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture and encouraging knowledge sharing.Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the customer experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.You Benefit FromCulture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Taryn Louise Bonugli

role: Senior DevOps Engineer at FreightHub GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description: At FreightHub we are building the backbone of global trade and as part of the engineering team you are working on the core of that mission every day. Based on a cutting edge stack, consisting of MongoDB, NodeJs, TypeScript, React and Docker, our goal is to digitize this industry - one step more with every release.We define ourselves as a customer-centric team that enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. Daily releases, a high degree of test automation and constant application monitoring is our standard. We strive to optimize our workflows, architecture and infrastructure every month because we know that there is always room to improve.To give you an idea, these are some example of what engineers at FreightHub are doing:We build quoting and routing algorithms to calculate prices for moving goods globally, e.g. what does it cost and how long does it take to move 150 bikes from Taiwan to Berlin via airplane, ship or railway?We ingest live tracking data of ships, trucks and airplanes to infer meaningful actions on the supply chain, e.g. re-routing shipments when a ship arrives late.We automate processes to lift the degree of automation from 5% to 90% - killing faxes, emails and phone calls from logistics once and for all.

role: Sr. Software Engineer - Recommendation at eBay (Berlin, Germany)
description: eBay Kleinanzeigen is flexible and fast like a start-up yet we part of the global eBay Family. Our 70-people sized company includes all functions to run our business and do fast decision making. Members of our team value the entrepreneurial spirit, the “can-do” attitude and their mutual respect for each other’s talent and contribution.We have one of the most-visited sites in Germany and are growing at an amazing speed. Currently, we have about 20 million active ads and more than 15 million monthly unique users – far more than half of them on mobile devices. All this traffic is powered by a set of Java 8/Spring applications and MySQL/Kafka/Cassandra/Elasticsearch servers that serve tens of thousands of requests every second. We use Kanban for development and have up to 10 releases a day, thanks to our fully automated continuous delivery pipeline.Our 25 people-sized development team is small yet excellent. We build and maintain virtually all software components eBay Kleinanzeigen is made of - from backend to mobile apps. role: Software Development Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: From a technology perspective, we have thousands of devices with our own firmware installed in our customers’ stores around the world and an advanced server infrastructure to manage these devices and process the terabytes of data that they are producing with Machine Learning algorithms. You will have a great opportunity for growing personally and professionally – while having lots of fun along the way.Join our team as a Software Development Intern!What we do all dayWe build most of our applications using Ruby on Rails because we love it. We experiment and try out new things a lot so we are looking for developers who not only like to build new prototypes or minimum viable products and like to be creative, but also have great ideas and enjoy trying them out. We also built our main data processing architecture with Python because we love it. This architecture has been made to scale horizontally and with no single point of failure. We are processing multiple gigabytes of data per hour using different machine learning algorithms.Any interest in data analysis or competence in data science would definitely be a plus.How we work:To be innovative and fast we organise our work using scrum and 1-week sprints.To be as efficient as possible, we reduce the time spent in meetings to the minimum.We love to test and we test all our code – we hope you like it too.We like to do pair programming and code review sessions.Where we work:We have a new office next to Checkpoint Charlie. It is spacious and cozy.There is everything you need to work in a great environment.We have food, fruits, coffee, tea, soda and also a couch with a big TV and a Wii U for the occasional Mario Kart race.Skills & RequirementsRequired skillsSome coding experience (in any language)Appreciated skillsExperience with PythonExperience with Ruby on RailsInterest or experience with data science and analysisWhy there are just a few required skillsWe believe that being a good developer is not so much a question of skills, but more a question of mindset. If you are passionate like us, you love to learn, work and share knowledge with your team, you will be a perfect fit. You will learn with us what is missing.

role: Data Science Intern at Minodes (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Do you love big data and analytics? Do you have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data? If yes, you will love working at MiNODES. At the core of our data analytics pipeline we apply advanced machine learning techniques to position people inside our customers' stores based on wifi signals. We are constantly improving these algorithms and are experimenting with new state-of-the art technologies (e.g. deep learning), to deliver the best data quality possible to our customers. With our Data Science team we work hard to help our clients to become industry leader for the future of retail. Therefore we offer an internship where you can apply current state-of-the-art machine learning models on a challenging dataset in an interesting industry.Potential Task you will work on during your internship:Identify potential weaknesses of our own MiNODES Wifi Positioning System and apply current state-of-the-art (e.g. Deep Learning) methods to overcome them.Build new use cases around clients problems that we're able to solve by the use of big data and machine learning techniquesImprove our data quality monitoring infrastructure and help to improve our internal QA ProcessesDuring your time at MiNODES you will be supported by our development and data science team.Skills & RequirementsWe're looking for preferably graduate students from statistics, computer science, business informatics, or related fields with:Excellent statistical intuition and knowledge of various analytical approachesExcellent communication skillsAt least theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques (both supervised and unsupervised learning)Ability to transfer theoretical concepts to practical implementationsProficient in at least one programming languageAbility to write efficient SQL statementsNot a must, but we appreciate the following skills:Proficient in PythonExperience with Scikit-learn, pandas, scipy, numpy and tensor flowKnowledge of advanced machine learning techniques such as: deep learning, unsupervised outlier analysis, support vector machines, random forests, etc

role: Web Development Enthusiast at Mister Mobile GmbH // DEINHANDY. (Berlin, Deutschland)
description: Die Mister Mobile GmbH steht hinter deinhandy.de – der schnellst-wachsenden Plattform im Mobilfunkmarkt und betreut darüber hinaus noch weitere Plattformen im Telekommunikationsbereich. In unserem Büro in Berlin-Mitte arbeiten wir täglich daran, die Sortimente und Angebote aller Anbieter transparent zu vergleichen und den Kunden das Leben etwas einfacher zu gestalten. Wir sind Hersteller- und Providerunabhängig und bieten unseren Kunden so unabhängige, persönliche Empfehlungen und eine One-Stop-Shop-Lösung von der Vertragskündigung, über sein neues Handy und / oder Tarif bis zur gratis Handy-Versicherung und weiteren Lösungen für Wearables, Apps und Smarthome Devices.E-Commerce ist einfach, richtig? Falsch! Jeder der schon mal mit diesem Thema gearbeitet hat wird vermutlich zustimmen, dass das Geschäft von außen immer recht einfach aussieht, es aber erst hinter den Kulissen richtig spannend wird.Bei DEINHANDY. verbringen wir unsere Zeit damit, genau diese spannenden Probleme zu lösen, ohne dabei den Blick auf das Frontend (also das, was der Kunde sieht) zu verlieren. Beides muss für uns in Einklang gut miteinander funktionieren.Wir atmen Code, leben von modernsten Technologien und für den Spaß an der Arbeit mit selbigen und miteinander.Weil wir uns noch viel vorgenommen haben um den Handy- und IOT-Markt weiter zu erobern, suchen wir hierfür Verstärkung in Form von enthusiastischen Web-Entwicklern.

role: C++ Engineers for plotting the quickest route at TomTom (Berlin, Germany)
description: Our team achieves more every day. So can you.We have been making navigation products since 2004 and we are not slowing down.Would you like to bring the navigation experience to life for millions of TomTom users?Do you want to work on a solution which operates on all sorts of devices and platforms?Does clean and maintainable code make you smile more than a good coffee?In the TomTom office in Berlin we are working on the NavKit solution. This is the complex C++-coded algorithm used to plot the quickest route to any destination, on any device. As we are ushering into the (highly) automated driving, the TomTom NavKit is not only improving human-machine interaction, but also machine-to-machine instruction. Please see this video for more information. As a C++ Engineer you are involved in improving the routing, the guidance or the visualization of the Navigation solution.Here’s a little taste of your challengeProduce great codeOne minute you are discussing race conditions in multi-threaded code on a review, next you are in a whiteboard session with your colleagues drawing up the design of the next feature:  you love what we refer to as “perfect code” that is recognized by your peers as being elegant and simple.Constantly develop yourselfLanguages evolve, platforms change and so you learn. You grab the chances we offer to develop yourself because you are curious and like to work with the latest tools and techniques in an ever changing technological landscape. Apply and expand knowledge with either: - complex algorithms (most probable path) - Digital Signal processing (GPS, Lidar) - DevOps / Continuous Integration
